LKxvo-TgOImdy-Ub1ZBf-A.text: The Stetson Chopped Salad with chicken is fantastic.  Located in Terminal B across from B21.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson chopped salad with chicken.

pAG5W9PSDSUZkc6tphIQAw.text: Bacon wasn't cooked. Ranks in my husbands worst breakfasts ever. Constant flagging down of waitstaff needed. Extremely expensive $24 not good enchiladas.

i6DNxPy0KVZfmsFEkSIw0A.text: This may be one of the best airport restaurants in the US. Pricey, yes for an airport but I think worth it. The chopped salad was one of the best salads I gave ever had. Very, very unique. I will always come back here when I am at PHX

IQVQZodADLSwS0S3fOOe7g.text: The food was excellent. I think this is the best prepared salmon I've had in a long while. I'm certainly going to look for more of these restaurants wherever I can find them!

JzayWulNJhyidcsUIuleGQ.text: Anytime i have a delay in the PHX airport, I trek over to the B gates to get some Cowboy C.  The stetson salad is very good with a generous portion of salmon, and the open face steak sandwich is steakhouse goodness on a bun.    The bread pudding is excellent with the right amount of sweet and a surprise bit of heat from some pepper flakes in the sauce.  Definitely ask for TJ if it is your first time in.  He will guide you based upon what you like and wont steer you wrong.  In addition, they can get you in and out quickly if you are pressed for time.

Rxs7w2akR6VpeK2c_X_9oQ.text: The mushroom pan fry with mixed green salad makes a nice vegetarian meal!

jm3nZSPbwUkHEJt8Fl5-Yg.text: Finally made it over to try one of the newer concepts in the airport! I kept hearing about how awesome it was but I have to say, I don't think it lived up to the hype. The staff was super nice and helpful. The restaurant itself was nice, reminding me of the street side location but the food was nothing too awesome. I will go back and have a try of something else cause I don't want to just write off a place based on something like the West Coast Wrap, which could be a taste preference. I think I'll go and have a try of the mac and cheese and judge it off that cause that'll be a make or break thing for me lol.

XTN2yQjlJZ57HTqsXpxYqg.text: Great waiter. Fast food delivery. The hash was just ok. Wouldn't order it again. Short on meat and egg was jelly like. Wiling to try the restaurant again just based on the service alone.

5kr8Y_jNF2Rc6X8j7Vv_zQ.text: People below who wrote ho-hum reviews.... you do realize that this is inside of SkyHarbor, right?  Quite frankly, the food is good enough to compare with some of the better food I've had in Arizona, all while having to deal with HMSHost and TSA!  I definitely recommend coming by if you've got a layover.

qieGGfLd0-yNQjRhpQM1zA.text: Best airport food EVER! Located directly across from Gate B21. I highly recommend this place! The food is outstanding!! We ordered the truffle mac-n-cheese, bruschetta and THE STETSON CHOPPED SALAD! It was amazing! I got grilled chicken instead of the smoked salmon and added avocado.

GbFUs3Opa32KWe-tZbeItQ.text: Excellent chopped salad...really unique blend of ingredients.  Another person at the table said burger was one of the best he's had.  Didn't taste like airport food and very fast service.

iNmvvDMG4-k9afAXnq4J3w.text: I stopped in for a beer and bite before my flight. I was disappointed in the service I received- bartender took orders from people on either side of me before even acknowledging I was there even though they were seated about 5 minutes after myself. I was bummed to learn that not only one but two beers I tried to order were out. I finally ended up ordering a Sam Adams..  I had a mixed green salad to eat- nothing fancy. It was a normal salad. Next time I'm flying out of PHX I won't be stopping here.

3SNDA8B7XiyRPhV_islwCA.text: This place is consistently good. Airport food generally sucks this place has really good food and the Bartender is always so friendly. Yay!

7_XRq4_xqn8Bhmy7SHgBBw.text: I cannot get enough of this place. I have yet to try something on the menu that I do not like. Their port vinaigrette is to die for. So is the brisket, tiger shrimp, mac n cheese... you pretty much can't go wrong with anything you order, it's all amazing.

5KABONXU-e9DweaSAySLJA.text: The chopped salad with smoked salmon, the Lost Highway Black IPA, the music....perfect!

y0pTAYG3ciE38VXaMMlvVw.text: We had a three hour layover in Phoenix and since we were sick of the typical airport food we had at our previous stops, we looked around for something a little nicer.  We got seated right away and the staff was super friendly.  We both had the sangria and shared some sort of mushroom dinner as well as the pulled pork.  The meals were amazing and I was still in shock that we were eating this well in an airport.  The food came really fast and it was an overall great experience.  If I ever happen to stop in Phoenix again I would for sure go back.

qL_fJy2Y4p1wE72Wzv6cbw.text: Amazing!  Never had airport food this good...ever!  The Open Faced Steak Sandwich was amazing as well as the homemade kettle chips w/Blue Cheese.  My new favorite Airport Restaurant, period!

raTWwdSpjMRXObdBcJ-Yfg.text: Awesome, friendly service. The beef in my salad was melt in your mouth tender. Far exceeded my expectations.

eW6GdM2u5gS-4uVYosrs5A.text: Had the Mac and Cheese and the Pork Hamburger with avocado. Good restaurant for being in an airport.

c_WAz7MXUoJ5-zOruuMz3g.text: So good I amost skipped the place due to it's stupid name.   Definitely eat here for airport food it's da best!

Pdmm2FKuhq9f29rQBQdnug.text: I give this place a minus 10 for very rude customer service by the manager, Justin,  and for serving me slimy, rotten lettuce in my salad. I confronted the Manager with the rotten lettuce and he looked at me with a straight face and told me this was how Spring mix looked!  He  then proceeded to accuse me of cheating the restaurant by eating the small bit of beef and leaving the rotten lettuce!   I finally received satisfaction  after calling the Main Cowboy Ciao restaurant in Scottsdale. Be ware!    The downtown restaurant claimed tome that  they do not own this branch, it is owned by HMS Host, this is fast food being served to you at the airport,  Falsely advertising their affiliation with another Cowboy Ciao in downtown Phoenix.   I have photos of the rotten lettuce which I sent along with complaint letter to Mr. Steve Thomas of  HMS Host and corporate offices of Cowboy Ciao.  Be careful if you decide to try this fast food establishment.

x1vO56Luc75TnG9fJ1mQ4Q.text: The food was great and really fast. My husband ordered the Reuben and I ordered the chopped salad. Despite the atmosphere and lackluster service, I almost felt like I wasn't in an airport. Let me reiterate, the salad was really really really good.   I'm still trying to figure out why I paid $13.50 for a glass of cheap champagne with a drop of bottled orange juice though... stay away from the mimosas. Blah.

NyekGcBckkVwm8K3VUGyMA.text: Great breakfast spot, I walked from the other concourse to come eat here. I was recommended the enchiladas and it was tasty. Great layover restaurant for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas breakfast

CrnAIgnm24PPUwleCfc6VQ.text: This is probably the best airport bar I've been to. I had an hr to kill and decided to stop here before my flight back to LA.  I walked on over and they initially had an issue with accepting cards and were cash only, but that was fixed by the time I left 2 drinks later.   There was open bar seating and I usually hate sitting at the bar by mself, but its the airport so eveyone is pretty much by themselves. Plus, i used the convienant outlets right underneath the countertop to charge my phone.   The bartender was great. I can't remember his name but he was helpful with recommendations and very entertaining as he sang to the overhead music.   I ended up getting a beer to start and then had a glass of Zinfandel to finish. The lady sitting next to me had it and recommended it, which was great. I had never actually had a glass of Zinfadel before then. It was funny because she had commented that no matter what time it is in the airport, people are always drinking. Granted it was 6pm when she said that, but her statment was True nonetheless.   She also got the quesadilla which apparentlynis a restaurant favorite. I guess I'll have to come back for that. Great experience and I would gladly come back again.

3gCV3o-jZwhRd8rgz4YT2Q.text: We were in a tad bit of a rush to grab food. With about 40 minutes before the doors closed a bite to eat seemed reasonable and the restaurant wasn't busy - we even asked for our food to go. The lady up at the front was very sweet I honestly wish I had caught her name but this review in particular is for the woman in the red shirt working behind the front counter greeting customers. Again, I didn't manage to catch her name, but let me tell you what this lady was DISGUSTING. When I had asked her how long our food had before being ready as our plane had already begun to board she proceeded to say things like "oh well I can't help you with that." "This is what happens when we have THOSE kinds of people working here." Referring to the sweet lady who had helped us earlier who was disabled and could barely walk. Her attitude towards us and towards her fellow coworker was appalling. I honestly wish I knew this woman's name so that she could get spoken to about her disgusting work ethic and attitude.

fOTq5ECGzlZrcq8eHfF5vg.text: Located in terminal 4, good luck getting waited on in the early morning. The bartender had his back turned talking to another employee. You would think with the time constrain in airport, employers would hire people with peripheral vision.

LepOoQjBp4gDS8OyXwrJoQ.text: Best breakfast I have had in an airport.  Breakfast enchiladas are amazing and the bacon was cooked perfectly.

5y9hD2bq6WWmTLz7I-TYpA.text: Avoid. I visited the location during a flight delay with the hope of getting a better meal than the McDonald's down the corridor offered. The service was really slow. Despite having two bar tenders in a small bar area, the bar tender that originally served me never asked if I wanted to order food after providing my adult beverage. It took finishing my beverage before the second bartender came over to check on me. The food menu was very eclectic and there were not many items that would appeal to airport customers. Especially since they were overpriced. To top of my experience, I was charged for someone else's beer.

UoinOs9sFLsj24om3Q01Mg.text: The menu has more alcohol choices than good. So it loses 2 stars for that alone. Not a huge selection. And the food is meh. Several of the menu items are the chef's special of the day...like the quesadilla del dia. Today it was chopped steak, potatoes, and a bunch of other stuff in it. I just wanted chicken in mine.   I'm not in the Phoenix airport often enough to be really annoyed, but it was tolerable in a pinch.

tF_IJ2DJLMyS8YTKZjtKCA.text: Food blew me away for being at an airport.  I had Thor famous salad with chicken and avocado and it was a great meal to have while waiting at an airport as it wasn't too heavy.  Someone else in my party had the chick n and waffles and she loved them.  The staff was super friendly.

Gbi8_rRSjGonMeLRsu-DCw.text: Pros: fast, friendly service. This is a definite asset for an airport restaurant. If you get a seat in the back there's a huge window with views of the planes.   Cons: the food isn't great, and it's pretty expensive. I had a chop salad, which left me feeling kind of nauseous the rest of the day. Not a great way to feel when you're about to get on a flight!

sr7_zpRkqQiKmIbmMC7q4A.text: This place was an unexpected find in the Phoenix Airport.   I had more than 2 hours of layover here, so after spending money on stuff I did not need in the shops, I settled into here to wait out the rest of my time.   The menu had an assortment to suit most tastes, from salads, to grazing (appetizers), to some signature smaller bites and entrees covering all the tastes from carnivore to pescatarian to vegetarian. I loved the wide variety on the grazing menu with items like pork barbacoa, bison tartare, buffalo carpaccio, crispy porkbelly, quesadilla, and a cheese plate.   I settled in with the Truffled Mac & Cheese topped with potato chips and crisp panchetta paired with a nice Brut Rose (which they offered by the glass or bottle).   All I can say, is that this is not your father's airport food. I felt like I was in a trendy local spot. The food was delicious, the wine list impressive, and the service was some of the most attentive I have ever had (never mind that I was in an airport).   While I rarely get to pass through Phoenix, I would definitely seek out Cowboy Ciao, in Terminal 4, the next time a layover permitted.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Truffled mac &amp; cheese and brut rose

jLdEJXCK_eTvkoifbMWSGg.text: In the mood to give a place at the airport 4 stars.  Stopped in to grab breakfast before a morning flight.  Started with some coffee of course, and ordered up the Chocolate Chip Pancakes, because I might as well board my flight and go right into a food coma.  The pancakes were nice and fluffy, with syrup...and some warm peanut butter to spread on them as well.   Mmmmm, carby, sugary goodness!  Filling for sure.  Not a bad place to grab breakfast before heading home.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate Chip Pancakes

TyqKcHVj6ZzfkMzp4BBZyA.text: Started off with yummy cocktails.   Both had interesting ingredients, very herby.  For lunch Mr B. enjoyed his Ruben sandwich with potato chips.   It was a very large portion,  we could have split it.   I ordered the steak sandwich, as I had been craving a steak all week.   When it arrived I was immediately disappointed in the size of the steak.  Two half dollar size medallions on a piece of french bread.   Like the old Burger King commercial stated,  "where's the beef?!"  There was a large portion of potato chips topped with gorgonzola , but the meat was almost non-existent.  I think at an $18 price point,  a larger piece of meat could be spared.   The manager happened to be making his rounds, so I told him of my plight.   He was very nice about it,  offered to get me more steak,  which I declined.   Interestingly he said the steak is weighed at 5oz.  Doubtful that was even close to 5oz.  Who ate my steak?!  The manager sent over a nice dessert  which was very thoughtful, and we were appreciative.     Our waiter was a polite gentleman and the ambiance is cool.   I'd come back again for drinks, but I'd stay away from the paltry streak.

Tyr23HIAZLXNm6gfzihcTw.text: I've never rated a restaurant (airport, no less) based almost solely on the personality of the person behind the bar. Just made me happy to be here with a long layover.

eUx8BZR9Trfk67NN5RAoqA.text: Absolutely delicious! I got the burger no bun and it was amazing!!! I am so happy I stopped here on my way to my next flight!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The burger, no bun! It was perfection!! So much flavor

vq9-kpzrUc_Ub-ED5KUwXQ.text: I would choose to eat here even if it wasn't at the airport. The food was actually pretty good! I was really hesitant about ordering my salad because I didn't think it would be filling but on the contrary! It really was so delicious! The dressing was phenomenal... I even started to dip my husband's chips in the dressing!! Go for the Stetson salad!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson with chicken and I added avocado!

iSA722PX-QrBh2lOA9YhTw.text: The "Not Your Common Salmon" was devine! Perfect service too!! I wish I flew to Phoenix all of the time to eat here! So glad I decided to keep walking thru the airport to find the right place for a quick gourmet meal!

ug4tf_zkj27bXJdkZ7EN9A.text: So with an almost 2.5 hour layover, I needed a place to just chill and enjoy a good meal. Airports are not known for that. Thankfully I came across Cowboy Ciao. Make sure to give this place a spot if you are spending some time at the airport.  Service is excellent and friendly. TJ and crew are very attentive and welcoming.   Got the soup of the day, a pulled pork. Looked great and tasted great.   The mushroom dish? Awesome and filling. I can't go into more detail because I'm too full and satisfied.

nYPMR0OtY8tFQ_kuiHZSeg.text: Shocked at what an awesome experience this was! As I wait for my layover to expire and I can head home, I decided to spend my couple of hours at this bar. Hostesses weren't extremely warm, but the bartenders made up for it. Oh...and the food...the food was actually that good. Frustrated servers couldn't even take away the quality and flavor of the dishes that were served.  Entrepreneur noted Cowboy Ciao as the best new airport restaurant, and I would venture to say it rivals most standard street restaurants. The Stetson Chopped salad with lemon grilled chicken was surprisingly out of this world! No joke. Thinking I may need to route all travel through Phoenix so I can visit this eatery.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson Chopped. Served deconstructed and mixed tableside. Chicken, corn, arugula, couscous, trail mix and tomato/black beans.

EpVJ_WiCIEv7nrUICA07-A.text: Ask for TJ, great service, enthusiastic, total professional and you can tell he loves what he does.  Try the Mac N Cheese (best mac and cheese I've ever had)  Also try the Stetson chopped salad with Salmon, even if you're not a salad person, you will absolutely love it.

tNJ-sNT_RzzpZ83GKpO3ag.text: Such a nice surprise. Fantastic food, unique drinks and service at an airport. I recommend the short ribs!

HWkOArVrRZaQm1HvG6wfjg.text: It is all about the Stetson Chopped Salad! You get a choice of chicken, smoked salmon or avocado.  I went avocado and licked my plate clean.  Well, kinda.  Almost.. I am a lady.  Sometimes. lol.   The wine list was above par for an airport spot and all the bartenders were amazing.  Nice ambiance and a friendly vibe all around.  All smiles. Aaaaaand power outlets everywhere! Seriously,  2-3 for every seat.  Brilliant.  Who doesn't need to charge their phone/laptop/ipad while traveling???   The name is odd to me because it sounds like a BBQ place made a baby w an Italian restaurant....when really it is New American/Southwest-ish.  Who really cares what the name is though? Definitely one of my fav airport spots.  Hats off.

mqN6uYlsTnDuJ-I3WknfAg.text: Service is mediocre to say the least. Food is over priced. Staff is isn't even entirely inviting. Also didn't think you could mess up Mac and cheese but it was super gross. And cold. So to any of my friends flying from Phoenix airport, please go somewhere else.

rC6oJH1nNZxXNdQ66xOETg.text: Thought I'd get the salmon salad here because I'm gluten free and choices in the airport are limited.   The cashier was helpful in getting the fried corn which was breaded off the salad,  but then there was all this pasta  in the salad that looked like rice that was unlisted in the menu.   Also that salad was very pricey at $20 (even for airport) . So in the end the menu was inaccurate I got glutenated and the food was expensive.

RCIv4P8nrok9tdLAyIFnUg.text: You will be happy you came here. I am always skeptical of restaurants that try and serve too many types of cuisine but this restaurant actually impressed me for airport food.  In fact, I don't feel like I am eating in an airport restaurant at all! I ordered the steak salad and the portion was generous and it was delicious. The waitstaff actually seemed to care about me as a patron and the service is good.

DiIngkEsOFGRGaP64Z1KCA.text: Writing the a bit into the future, so some of the details are hazy..  Stopped here on a layover in Phoenix on the way to LA.  Ordered the Lester Burger which could have easily been two meals.  Burger, bacon, avocado, pulled pork and more on a single sandwich.  Delicious.  Met a new friend in the military also on a layover and we bought drinks for each other.    Waitstaff was attentive and seemed happy to be there.  Food came out quickly and drinks didn't stay empty for long. Had a nice time.  Easily one of the best airport dining experiences I've ever had.

mFlvI41WUBowEvR6BRCRtw.text: Nice restaurant in the Phoenix airport. Delicious food, a nice bar to sit at if you're trying to grab a quick drink between flights. Nice booths with windows if you have a little more time to kill. Restaurant is pretty far down the B terminal, so keep that in mind with where your gate is and timing. Overall, a great experience.

hlcnw0m2OIJm2foFUSdaPg.text: This not your ordinary airport dining experience! TJ the waiter is awesome- he is totally committed to providing you with a a fabulous description of the entrees- go for the stetson chopped salad! Thanks tj!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson chop... Awesome!!

KqymLuqd2SMMFf1BkDZrFw.text: TJ is an awesome server i have eaten here lots before always worth the wait to be seated.

i6risgJkTF7ftBw6o4axoQ.text: Of course you are at the airport so keep that in mind.  The food is not good - I had their special Reuben sandwich - it was dry the meat wasn't tender and very small portion for $16. Over priced even for the airport - save your money and eat at McDonald.

UtUEQNtaQ-Ej01yzHNLy5w.text: So if there as any airport pretty much in the world I would least rather stick at it be PHX. Stumbled upon this spot when we missed our connection and I got to say I was blown away. Amazing service attentive genuine not your typical I hate my life experience. Had the salmon which was stellar. Highly recommend. Great quality and great service.

5D_m1sdn13AkB9Cz_2nuAg.text: Airport bar restaurants. They have you captive. If you don't want food court fare, you can cool your heels at some place a little more chi-chi. The decor and menu here appear better than what the actual offerings are. Fortunately I've found another place I truly enjoy in the hub that is the Phoenix airport, so I won't have to bother with Cowboy Ciao again. Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't particularly bad. But it didn't merit the cash we splashed out.

RwDroPEFb7XNdyZdGNuOdw.text: Very bad bad bad service, bad bad bad attitude and bad food. Disgrace of Phoenix or more.

hi253C0kTorazGvRPBkLbg.text: For an airport restaurant, this was amazing.  We ordered:  Mac and Cheese Asiago Bread Margarita VIVA cocktail Sangria  The food was to die for! The Mac and Chesse was out of this world. Probably the best I've ever had. The Asiago bread was also amazing! It was so full of flavor, but the one thing I must say about the bread is that it's a bit messy. Also, the bread is very filling, make sure to have others to share it with.  The drinks were okay. The VIVA cocktail was very sweet (and I love sweet)! Very overwhelming for taste buds. The margarita was very good, just make sure to specify which kind of tequila you want. The sangria is one for sangria lovers. It grew on me, but first sip was kind of atrocious.   The service was really good. My waiter was extremely knowledgeable, and very kind.   I will definitely come back here when I have to stay at the Phoenix Airport for any length of time.

_Fk7upj4bgvSoLA24dvogA.text: The food here was some of the best I've had, not just in an airport, but just in general. My boyfriend and I had brunch here before our flight out and we were more than happy with the taste, quality and service of our entire experience.

qP02Gm1f1PYgv6nkU7mHOA.text: Horrible customer service! One of the servers "TJ" damn near ripped a plate out of my friend's hands and told her that he'd just take the food if she wasn't going to eat the dish right! Like seriously dude?! Y'all need some serious customer service training! I gave it one star because zero stars wasn't an option.

JuNwTMjWVH8ywHgTv4a-tQ.text: Is it just me, or is airport food getting better?  I stopped at Cowboy Ciao in a hurry before my flight.  Vegan food isn't always easy to find in an airport, but Ciao hit the spot.  I had a spinach wrap loaded with arugula, tomatoes, avocado, salsa and corn.  The wrap was super fresh and tasty but it was the potato chips that took the meal to the next level.  The homemade chips were a little thicker than average, and were very brown.  I used to toss out the brown ones in favor of the pasty white chips.  Not anymore.  These thick, perfectly browned and salted chips were among the best I've ever had.  If you're catching a flight at Sky Harbor, check out Cowboy Ciao, and get those chips!  Oh, and the counter lady was super nice!  Nice matters!

MObt0F64-c2C7rxzAKBU0g.text: The food was decent for airport food, but I don't think it's better than any other options in terminal 4. The chicken didn't have much flavor and all the spread was concentrated in the bottom of the wrap. The chips tasted fresh but were very greasy and soggy.  The wrap and chips combo cost me $14 and left me wishing I'd just gone to Le Madeleine for a sandwich ($6.99)...even with chips AND a drink it wouldn't have cost $14, and I would have felt I got my money's worth. Based on the great reviews, maybe their hot food options are better than their to-go items.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. West Coast Wrap...Asiago crusted chicken with roasted poblanos, corn, pickled onion, etc and chips.

kNcIQ5PPRI7S1DQojBzrOw.text: High expectations, bad awful service, I sat down waitress came by took my order and that was the last I saw her. Didn't order a 5 course meal, just a burger . Come to find out my order was given to someone else..30 minutes later no food-unfortunate....what a total waste of my time!

uEluKM87FiAZjOsc7ge5qw.text: This was my first experience here. After a 20 minute wait I got burnt chicken on my sandwich and much, much too salty fries for $17. Won't be returning on my next layover in PHX.

PdipZXKupmuEGE1j2p-8HQ.text: I'm not a vegetarian but that delicious mushroom dish entree was what I needed. Much better than the $5 on a coffee or carb item I would like to stress eat till I get home. Take my money and thank you for making it taste good.  Oh and the service was fast and refilled my water.

C67-EuneF6DVieg3AV3_9A.text: My family and my husband and I stopped here tonight pre-flight to Heathrow.   We split the bill, and gave our waitress 2 credit cards.  She comes back with 1 card and the bill charged on my card.  We ask for the other card...she can't find it.  The distance between our table and the cashier table was less than 3 feet.  For the next 10 very stressful minutes we tear the area apart searching for their card.  Security & the manager are called in to look.  My brother is ready to cancel the card.  Fortunately, a customer 2 seats down from us stands up and the security guard sees a card under his seat.  The restaurant manager did not even offer to compensate us for anything.  Are they running some sort of scam?  Not sure.

aE8WClh7nxTkXX43pfYKUg.text: This is the best restaurant I've dined at in PHX, and that is high praise since many of the best, chef-owned and founded restaurants have satellite locations here (which makes this airport great!) The service at the bar is excellent, the salads and brunch food are amazing, and the dr oks are superb.

52E6ou94SAwLiqPZnJ_ySg.text: Sat down to get a quick appetizer between flights. They didn't have a lot of options so settled for a steak sandwich. It would've been great except there were 3 black hairs in it. We had paid before we got the food and had to catch our flight, so we didn't even bother letting them know. Unfortunate.

mKQsJ3cvUdyGtbGNn4t5TQ.text: Worst Ruben I have ever had.  The bread was soggy and the chips were soaked in oil.  The service was great.  The wine was over priced, but typical for airport prices.  Not a fan and would not return.

BGFvUDiL39omDyurxJCLYg.text: If you're not at the bar the service is painfully slow when packed. However this is a good spot to pass up time in the airport. They have drink specials, I enjoyed the buy a single make it a double for 1/2 off! The food menu looked great, everyone's food that was coming out smelled and looked so dang good. I wouldn't hesitate to come back but I'll definitely sit at the bar.

FMr_r_6Necc_fusz7moftQ.text: I understand  that a airport terminal bar/restaurant gets busy but sitting at the very from table for 13 Minutes with the waitress passing by over 12 times with no greeting water or anything.  This the poorest service I have ever had at sky harbor, which is too bad because the menu looked good.  Almost had a customer, I will never know there goes your 150 tab

QRinukdYw7zXkmdUZJKZhw.text: Wow.  What a cool concept.  I got the exotic mushroom pan fry....mushrooms in an ancho cream sauce over polenta topped with grilled baby portables, avocado, tomato and cotija cheese.  Super umami in the tastebuds.   Best thing I ever ate in an

CbO65L4P7dAZ-nkMYyXbSQ.text: Wanted to try the cobbler because of the yelp reviews and waited almost 45 minutes for this messy plate. Wish I could give it ZERO stars. Most of the apples were not cooked and the "caramel was just chunks of burnt sugar. This place is a trainwreck.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0iL8pqIp8ycV742ukscc2Q.text: This is for the service. I ordered the testosterone salad Togo because I have a flight to catch and I asked if I can get ice water refilled in my water tumbler. The lady who took my ordered agree to refill my drink then the manager came and was like you can refill the water at the water filter by the restroom. I LITERALLY ORDERED A $20 SALAD I WOULD EXPECT TO JUST GET SOME ICE WATER. Please reconsider going here bc the service I received was unlike any other.

t6JrMiw0tLDZj4Pxxckp7A.text: Our food took over an hour to receive. The burgers were overcooked and hardly any fries were on our plates. The restaurant should be renamed Cowboy Chaos from the disorder and lack of professionalism shown by the staff. This is an airport restaurant and the staff and kitchen should act like it. Pathetic all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3wdT_707BYrSxTPCbaMoNg.text: Yum! This place is getting a five star BEFORE my food gets here. The owner/chef is on the cover of his menu. Hottttt.   So far, I've had a margarita and his picture is looking even better. Yum! I'll post a picture of his menu's cover page. You can see for yourself.  Margarita is pretty good too!   The waitress, Maria, super sweet. Fantastic service. She's very helpful in helping me decide what to order. I've ordered the Burrata Insalata with chicken. I'll update my review and let you know how it tastes.  Update:  The Burrata salad is delicious!!!! You get a generous portion of real ooie-gooie Burrata, seasoned to perfection. Cherry tomatoes, arugula, avocado topped with crispy onions. I ordered with chicken. Everything is seasoned well, you can eat them separately or combine them. Either way, delicious.  Cowboy Ciao definitely makes this airport wait time a pleasure.   It doesn't hurt that the chef is a hottie and his picture is on the menu.

PNCkZ0UA7DOU7RfFslTyyA.text: Got the burger cuz it seemed tasty with piled on pork and "jalapeno aoili".  Unfortunately it just tasted like a regular dry burger from Ruby Tuesday's. I'm from LA and maybe am spoiled with juicy and flavorful burgers...so this was pretty disappointing.

uZcbvIroFkCQTiXkc_w_mA.text: Typical airport location and food but what made this a 5 star place for me is that the staff is not only friendly to the customers but they're so kind and fun towards each other. Made for a positive environment for my 2 hour flight delay. Whomever is building morale keep it up!

_ZrMa_jPjgWByfEvuAL9sQ.text: Awful. Just spent $20 for salmon with Brussels sprouts and potatoes. Brussels sprouts were overdone, potatoes were of cheap hotel breakfast buffet quality but greasier. No freshness. Salmon was unseasoned. Now I see why the location in Phoenix went bankrupt.

BSNkQ1jqVCh5xQTmLRQfyw.text: Good beer but the tiger shrimp small and maybe 5 of them Creamy corn good but definitely not worth 16$

sR9fjKhJ5cnQgInBqbtOiA.text: Came in for a few drinks before our flight, service was prompt and attentive. Russell is a personable and funny bartender. Next time I fly I'm coming here for my wait time.

j5qLiq-7TAMc-eqjbuA0wA.text: If you have a layover, you need to stop in here for a bite.  The owner must be brilliant because they have all price ranges and just what you want when you are traveling combined with gourmet options.  Kenna took care of us, she was personable and professional, a usually tough balance.  The Punk had chicken and waffles. Her quotes, "Everything is SO good!" , "I wish I could eat here again later!", "These are the best waffles I've ever had!", "We can eat here all the time and I will get the same thing over and over!" Pretty sure she liked it.  They also offered to allow us to bring in nearby McDonald's for the Punk, so if you have little ones that like what they like, this is your best option.   I tried the pastrami style ribs, I must admit, they were different and really good. I would get them again even if they are the most expensive thing on the menu.  We had a guest diner who tried the sweet mustard slaw from the Punks plate. Although she is a mayo loving, mustard hating individual, she said she likes this slaw better than regular slaw.  DEFINITELY ON THE TO DO LIST IF YOU HAVE TIME IN PHOENIX.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami style short ribs, 3 day brine, ginger/brown sugar/paprika-rubbed, mesquite smoked.
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Best waffle I&#39;ve ever had!&#34;

ui6E_-Cl4VsvCxDrQA1pRQ.text: Pretty good spot in the Phoenix Airport. I ordered the Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry and was pretty pleased with the overall taste. A whole slew of different types of mushrooms in a savory brown gravy with avacado and polenta.  The menu had some interesting/unique fare which I really like. I would definitely come back to try their breakfast enchiladas and a number of items on their 'grazing' section.  The staff was friendly and fast, too. Overall, I'm a happy and full traveler.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry

AkROz6sdhmwGwsJySPNYag.text: Loved the service from Douglas! Explained to him my flight left in an hour he set me up with a quick and tasty recommendation, a glass of wine to set the mood of the 4 hour flight ahead and all Is good! Thank you Douglas!

PDaVxhgB5rLX8NVOHTVGsw.text: Best food in Arizona this trip!  The chips are fantastic, the burger the greatest, the mushroom polenta dish has our inner foodies going, the drinks lovely, the service by TJ beyond the call...  Definitely, this is just a taste of the larger restaurant in Phoenix.  Next trip- already making plans.

yQiy9-4nPuuKxQQVV2MD4g.text: The mac and cheese is amazingly good for airport food. This place is #1 at sky harbor.  The manager has been here 18 years. The bar tender Tai has been her 16 years. Their dedication proves worthy in the food and service. When visiting sky harbor in Phoenix make this a must between other choices!

yUZmTmajWQqb9hG_lz-jLA.text: Not sure where the "cowboy" in the name comes through in the restaurant or the food but I was very pleased with the food! Especially for airport dining. The chicken and waffles and biscuits and gravy were some of the best I've ever had. Our waiter was very friendly and personable too.

5akSWKq70POZ9uId-lAlyA.text: Salad was good, service was great. Unfortunately the apple cobbler was not only expensive ($10), but a huge disappointment. If you're tempted by it, just pour three packets of sugar on a raw apple slice and you've got the idea.  I'd give CC another chance, but will be avoiding the deserts.

yj8A54D76Dxmf0kEskdFeA.text: I usually try to avoid layovers at PHX due to the lack of good food choices.   I tried the cowboy Ciao today and my burger was legit!  Pulled pork on top of a nice hamburger patty. Great service.  The best food choice in PHX airport.

SJtnYaHX5cACI3gXbr1yjQ.text: Had the open face steak sandwich with home made potato chips.  Excellent!!!  Prices are typical for airport (higher than normal) but nothing outlandish.  Place is very busy even at 8:30pm, but that's a good sign.  I'll be back.

R6KKAZ4vTqGkdrL1PLJcxg.text: Had breakfast here.  The food was delicious, and the service was divine. Thank you TJ!  We had a wonderful pre-flight meal and TJ had us in a in a great mood while dinning!

PhMgCzWDYmrzKe3J0eWvXw.text: Cool! So great to discover eats in an airport that makes you feel good. Cowboy Ciao did just that! The unforntunate part is that I arrived just before 8am and was still not hungry from the night before. I just wanted to relax for a couple hours and have a coffee in a real cup, nut paper or styro. Finally I chose to mozey in. Nice little table for two. Waitress, Jennifer, greeted me and brought my coffee. She was such sweetheart! I later decided to have either and mimosa or Bloody Girl and Jennifer assisted so authentically with that, asking if I liked spicy. Yes! I only wish it were 3hr later. But I did see several breakfast dishes and they were perfect. Breakfast potatoes looked just how I prefer! Oooooo I wish I could be hungry!! Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry would be my first choice. I just hope I can go through Phoenix on my next flight! And best of luck to Jennifer!

ThRmHCmRYPhxrt27SJTkzw.text: Most amazing salad ever. They also have some outlets, and my server was very nice. The margarita was so-so. Still, this place made my flight delay more bearable and I'm going to be craving the chopped salad for awhile.

iBbdwBNm-PQDpiBlp7rk3w.text: Ate here once, and its just OK If it was not in an airport, I would not go back...  lol

DLPGMg4b0kuo-Cb6Nv2sAQ.text: I have sat at the bar hear numerous times and have gotten great service. Twice I have been seated at arable and have had terrible service and once told I needed to have at least three in my party to sit at a table. The same man and women have provided poor service and were unprofessional both times.

8XErhnwALrNodRyPpSz5lw.text: Had the chopped salad and it was a refreshing healthy twist and loved the atmosphere for being inside an airport :-)

ZKkSPmXaksBY0POM9DhnRQ.text: Good place for a meal. Much better than airport fast food. The breakfast enchiladas have tasty shredded beef. The salsa and pico de gallo provide the right amount of spice. Two eggs any style provide extra protein. Avocado provides a splash of green. It also has liquid courage for your flight.

TbZrN6WptSsb5j2KfwJ1mQ.text: Came here a few months ago and ordered an open face sandwich and steak salad. For airport food it's actually good. Today we had ordered the chop salad as well as the tomato cream soup. The soup was very tasty as well as creamy. The salad, which was good however was meant apparently for a child. The salad, which is very pretty don't get me wrong is striped with tomatoes, sweet corn, tasted like corn pops as well as chicken. There is also trail mix thrown into the salad. The avocado ranch tastes homemade, but the portion size is ridiculously small!!  I would suggest giving a little more food to the customer considering your charging higher end restaurant fees for small portions in a airport! The host was really sweet too and had to throw how a drunk customer.

BmTgqgGca3QjysVZlS1_TQ.text: Food wasn't too great, though the service was fast and thr price wasn't bad. I would suggest going to a different place.

pgWFcmQ2C2Z69xpRYPFvdg.text: Connecting to Oakland. Flight delay allowed me time to check out this restaurant. Got the Sangria and West Coast Wrap. Liked the homemade chips that came along with my wrap thought they could do with a little seasoning. Pleasant wait staff, knowledgeable on the menu. Prices comparable to other airport restaurants. Definitely beat the paid for meal the airline was offering.   I'm sure I'll be passing through again and would consider returning in the future if in this terminal area but won't go out of my way.

zURWLDPfOVn4RqOhVBxywg.text: Probably the best airport food you may have had. Service is typically good as well. Try the chop salad. Healthy and tasty.

FonWxUkT_k_PfGGsB5KbjQ.text: I have been to this var at least a dozen times but have never bothered to give it a review until tonight. I just had one of the worst travel days I had ever experienced when I met the bartender, Tige. He was so ridiculously friendly to all of his customers it actually bettered my mood! I had the bruschetta and it was quite good. If ever at the PHX airport stop in and see Tige! He will make your day!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not a great photo but delish!

QQ04HEU5CIzTBAmYnRo9jw.text: Nice staff. Food and drinks over priced even for the airport.  Very very limited menu. Annoying music.  And it doesn't take much to impress me.....

KTPU23Q5axMb_wdF7EW3Kw.text: Just are here and the food was great and very filling. I had the chicken and waffle "sandwich", which is a piece of fried chicken and half a red velvet waffle. I'm not a coleslaw kinda girl so I opted for the homemade chips on the side. I finished with the Oh Canada Peanut Butter Bat, which was delish.  Service was great! They were super helpful and came by at just the right time.

9YyAF4C83NggjHlst-B8AA.text: Unbelievable. During a long layover in the airport we stopped by to eat here. It was me, my wife and our 6 month old baby who was asleep in our small pop-up stroller. The restaurant only had a couple of tables occupied and I'd guess about 90% empty at this time. The employee came up to the front and we asked to be seated. She proceeded to tell us that it was a safety hazard to have a stroller in the restaurant and that we could be seated by the rail and we would have to leave our sleeping baby in the stroller in the terminal hallway just outside of the restaurant. Clearly I was in shock at this request. This was our baby's first flight and he just fell asleep after having troubles popping his ears during the flight. Clearly I am not going to leave him anywhere but next to us. I proceeded to tell her we would find food elsewhere. I will NEVER eat here. Thank you to a very busy "Matt's Big Breakfast" restaurant across the airport who had no problem seating me and my family with the stroller.

paAZXMAHl0QBaJGWLIRWmg.text: Great healthy food at an airport.  Amazon salad.  Staff are awesome too.  Coming back here when in PHX.  A must try.

CNyb-o5vgmzsm4A5-gP2hQ.text: To be frank I was disappointed with the food. I expected better even though it was in an airport. The presentation of the chopped salad was unimpressive. There was hardly any salad dressing so it was dry. I ordered chicken and paid $2 extra for avocado and there was hardly any chicken or avocado. All and all it was a small forgettable overpriced salad. It wasn't bad, just small, dry, & bland. The diet coke was refreshing and the best part of the $25 meal.

9UwU_kVNgj4HAOQTg74tog.text: Great place for a drink. Fast service and they expedite. I didn't have food but will be back for sure next time at B gates in PDX.  They really a lot better than most airport bars in terms of speed and service.

6gipHAQw_A18GlyVxtcdbw.text: Pricey but in line with airport pricing. Great food. I second the chopped salad and Kobe beef recommendations. Was not disappointed. 3 local beers on tap and they're good!

O-4V9a7Bm_7TTNRd5-beGg.text: 1. Airport food rarely is this good.  2. Their prices don't necessitate a 2nd on your home.

hrYtufAXZFVfLL8v74tSwA.text: Wow, not bad for airport food! We had a connection at Sky Harbor, and it was 1 Eastern so I grabbed something to eat across from our gate. The line was fairly short, but it took forever. I don't know if that's because an order was complex or it was just slow, but it was bad.  I got a west coast wrap with chips, and it was pretty pricey. The wrap was excellent though. It tasted very fresh and had plenty of stuff inside it. The chips were exceptional--probably some of the best chips I have ever had.  What can I say? Good airport food! All right! Thumbs up!

q3bxR574dz7uxvQ88jCfeQ.text: In my travels tried this place again.  No luck.  This bar + food joint is worthless, they have no purpose in the airport due to mismanagement.  Cowboy Chumps, please leave the terminal and let someone who knows how to manage a business, offer good food, and pander to high paying clients, take over.  I believe in natures method, that the weak and worthless to die off and make room for the successful.

OqwCcTKA_JirfLI5o3eCRQ.text: Sky Harbor has upped their food game. Cowboy Ciao offers the perfect on airplane meal - chopped salad! I got the  chopped salad (which, I have to say is very expensive, more than at the real restaurant I think.... 14$), and took it on my looong flight to Boston. Halfway through the flight, I had the pleasure of eating this delicious mix of textures, flavors, and temperatures. I would recommend this if you  are hungry at the airport.

fMiHawsbQwZo70H4f3x0DQ.text: On a 3-hour layover in Phoenix, I restrained myself from physically harming the multitudes of luggage-wielding cattle that walked right in front of me, stopped right in front of me, managed to trip themselves on my luggage, and be overall rude.  On a 3-hour layover in Phoenix, I searched for a place to regain sanity, relax, and eeeaaattttt. Well, that and grab a bloody mary.  Enter Cowboy Ciao. As soon as I stepped up, I was greeted and asked if I needed an outlet.   Um, YES PLEASE.  I got to sit at a table with a plug, munching away at my perfectly-crispy breakfast quesadilla (yum!) and zesty bloody mary, away from the circus just outside of the restaurant.   I left relaxed & full, and so did my iPhone.   On a 3-hour layover in Phoenix, my faith in Sky Harbor was renewed by Cowboy Ciao.

S8Ya6qLAu0pUQMWxw1-elQ.text: I've had better brisket, but never as a Reuben. On my previous visit I neglected to check in but had amazing breakfast enchiladas (I've had better fried eggs but not over tomatillo sauce).  Everything looks amazing, smells better, and lives up to the olfactory expectation it sets. The sauces are fresh tasting, not over-vinegared the way pureed salsa so often are. You can tell they're beginning with fresh ingredients and high quality cuts of meat. If I were ever in a part of Phoenix other than the airport you can bet your @$$ I'd be headed to their location on Stetson, especially if the awesome service here is a consistent factor there.   I want to be clear, I have liked both my servers so much that when the incredibly rude couple that just left came in to sit here and eat McDonalds (seriously, what the heck? go sit at a gate like everyone else who wants to eat that garbage) I got offended that my charming waitperson had to even speak to them.  This is a four star experience and the staff makes it five, if you have to fly through Phoenix then skip breakfast to save room!

fAIQLMZxdc31LY_OFDuGEw.text: I looooved the chopped salad- one of the best salads of my life. We had a tomato basil soup and side of chips. All were good :) this may be my new go to restaurant at the PHX airport :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato basil soup
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade chips

XyUcpzjWjXhuoOgnqFBseQ.text: Had the Truffle Mac & Cheese because that's quick.  It came in a small bowl, just the right portion.  It's topped with some potato chip crumbs which was rather odd tasting.  The Mac itself was so watery that it was worse than Kraft.  One star is being generous.

OJ0RiwOLEfMpzuopAlgZeA.text: My favorite is the Stetson chopped salad. I walk to the B gates every time I'm at the airport to grab one to take with me. Delicious!

MV0JC8ClJM8tRdBgSvl7hw.text: Had the testosterone salad and it was really good. It's hard to mess up a salad but the beef that came with it was very tender and the salad itself was fresh and had the perfect ratio of blue cheese dressing which can be overwhelming if it isn't carefully added. Plus, it had potato chips which gave an extra crunch. I actually liked this place better than the restaurant I went to outside the airport. Customer service was also on point and they played cute, feel good 60-70s music.

ZPRHQwekV-F3eBzGlRMb4A.text: Got stuck at PHX on a 6 hour layover. Had some great local brews and tasty sandwich.  Made the layover worth while.  Thanks CC.

EntLySL4ZOJKrGeBOCAxTg.text: Best airport food I've ever had. Ever. I had the bruschetta and a side salad. The bruschetta was two traditional ones and then two that were a mushroom version of bruschetta. So good. And then the side salad was not only large but it had blue cheese crumbles and pumpkin seeds! Holy monkeys it was good.   The bartender was also super friendly (which is good in an airport since I came here annoyed that my flight was delayed) and he helped me pair some wine with the bruschetta!   It turned my crap travel day into being fairly enjoyable for being stuck here for extra hours.

0iTGtk1Be4nJEbQL581WMw.text: I am surprised by the number of great reviews for this place. My food was awful and the service wasn't much better.  It is an airport and it was a busy time of day but still.  I was seated at a counter and it was quite uncomfortable and I had to wait to order, wait for my food, and wait an interminable amount of time to get my check. I ordered the beef quesadilla and it had no flavor whatsoever and the chopped up roast beef had bigs hunks of fat in it- so unappetizing!  The waitress was nice but it was hard to get her attention and I had to flag down a different one to get my check.  Hey, I got a plane to catch, people! Next time I'll just go to McDonalds.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef quesadilla - looked better than it tasted, folks

vIj8C_fVdnwlJ6s5NZtFDA.text: Not often you find an airport restaurant that you would frequent if not stuck in an airport.  Very prompt cheerful service.  I sat at the bar and had the open faced steak sandwich.  Very flavorful with a 5 star presentation.  For the price I was expecting the typical airport food value vs price disappointment.  This is definitely not your fathers airport food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Open faced steak sandwich

KI6AZuyEt3uMUjLu-e_h3g.text: I have to say. I like this location. I am having their Waygu burger and it is amazing!  Fresh potato chips, cooked to perfection. I've never had a better burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fG_E-mCVCrbGDgq90YQaKA.text: I've had it with this location. We always know the food will be sub par compared to the Old Town location, but coupled with the rude wait staff, terrible service, dirty tables, and overcrowded atmosphere, we won't be coming back.   Tips for CC:  1. Don't take the drink order of the table sat 5 minutes after us and not take ours at all.   2. Don't tell us there is no way you can get a salad out to us in FIFTEEN MINUTES. Are you serious? The Stetson Chop is your staple and I know it would take less than 3 to plate that thing.   3. Hire wait staff that aren't rude, lazy, and haughty.   I know this location does huge business, but that's because they're the only restaurant down the B wing. Honestly you're better off taking an extra 10 minutes and getting food elsewhere.   We're not going back, and are even considering never going back to the Old Town location because of how we were treated at the airport location.   We can find the Stetson Chop recipe online anyway! Hahaha

Ua4BcIPZEJ6G60dKrDKnAQ.text: For airport food, this was the best salad ever. A bit pricey, but totally worth it. Sometimes it sucks to eat alone, but not this time. Waitstaff super friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Excellent salad!

A1hljj-SWh5eJcwp_BD_0A.text: Great little gem in terminal 4. Staff is all smiles, food is better than anything else in this airport and there is a fantastic selection of beer, wine and spirits. Big but cozy bar makes for an easy stop while waiting for your flight. I'll be back soon!

vwaHO5if2ktDG86k6pB8xA.text: Airport food has left much to be desired. The turkey melt sandwich was extreme dry and tasteless. Just bad. I felt like I ate a piece of turkey between two tasteless croutons. The burger is over shadowed by stale bread.  If you think you should grab a bite before a long flight pass on this eatery. Not worth the money or calories.

1BFEeYDYQXEK-C4sDVto5g.text: Nice and quiet and good service. The shredded green chili pork quesadilla was awesome. However, no chips and salsa available. Margaritas were good.

VPFZrxIlozDDJ9Oy41rOEw.text: When I sat down I was greeted by a female bartender who was getting another order and tried at least 10 times to get the attention of a male bartender to take care of me. He finally came over an looked at me like he didn't know what to do. I had to tell him that I wanted to order the Stetson salad and a water.   When they brought my salad, they never mixed it for me like I have read in other reviews, good thing I have been to the Gladly and knew what to do. I never received silverware and had to ask for it. The male bartender never came back to see if I wanted more water. I had to ask him for my check.   A male customer sat down next to me and was greeted right away an asked what he wanted.

B4NgawOOo7roRH8tzGG_7g.text: Things were hectic, as one would expect at the airport, but Russell was great, the bruschetta was delicious and the beer is cold!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato and mushroom bruschetta and a tall draft

MGGB_xndmWW20-PzM7lylw.text: solid spot to spend if you happen to have a layover in phoenix airport. the hubby and i grabbed a table during brunch time.   he drank beers, and i went with spicy tito bloody marys. a double will run you around $15 a pop.   the menu sounded really appetizing, a little bit of everything to choose from. mike ordered the PLT- pancetta, lettuce, and tomato on a muffin with spicy mayo. the pancetta was def just bacon, and the spicy mayo was mayo. so pretty ordinary for the high price. it came with really delicious homemade potato chips. could've ate like 3 bowls of those! i had an order of the biscuits and gravy. the gravy seemed to be bacon based, interesting change from the usual sausage base. the biscuits it was poured over were decent. i liked the addition of crispy fried onions on top.   cowboy ciao is definitely a solid alternative to your standard airport dining experiences.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy ($6)

auA8MBnIDuaxzAeYIDkY0g.text: this was the worse experience I have ever had in the PHX airport. I go to the restaurant in Old Town...don't go there Ordered a burger medium rare with a salad ...  35 mins later got a well done burger on a old roll with a dried in pc of cheese on it . no dressing for the salad and no aioli for the burger...got the dressing but the mgr came over to tell they were out of aioli and yes the burger was over done ..but they took off the bill.   doesn't help when you are hungry the only thing  eatable is the small salad on the plate. no one cares there ...even the people seating you are out of it

lrO6G7bUHOn3IiVyqJ8Q-A.text: On layover, stopped in for a burger. Was ok but relatively tasteless.  Bun was crumbling and too large for meat. Meat really had no flavor. Not a bad burger, just not great. Fries too, kind of bland. Service ok but not great.

StmvcSRBJv_q_5dXOKIjKQ.text: I always give extra points for good service, even if the food isn't outstanding. I waited at the hostess stand for over 10 minutes! Wait staff kept walking by without even acknowledging my presence. It was so weird that even another patron asked if I was in line because I was getting no service.  Finally, I was seated in the back. It was so noisy that people had to scream to be heard. I was traveling alone so I just put on my noise canceling headphones. A weird way to eat, but it worked.  My waiter was actually really nice. He made great recommendations, was engaging, and made sure that my hot water pot was always full for my cup of tea.  The food itself was ok. Despite the large crowd, it was ready in a normal amount of time. The thing I like about this place is the variety. When you travel alot, the options seem to be burgers or salads. Expect something a little different here.   If they turned the TVs down a little bit, I would come on every trip

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese

RprbuNhdzvEQ3E--jAup7A.text: Nice atmosphere and creative menu, but poor execution earned Cowboy Ciao 3 stars today.   My husband and ate breakfast here before flying internationally. We were in a good mood and looking for a yummy meal to kick off the trip. I asked how the Mexcal Mule was and our server told me it was horrible! I appreciate the honesty, but the margarita I ordered instead was a major disappointment. My husband's bloody Mary was watery and tasted like a bad mixer. His meal of Chorizo Enchiladas was a little bland, but not bad. I really enjoyed the flavors and textures of the Pig 'n Puddin' (or some spelling variation), but the polenta was more of a cream-of-wheat consistency than the toothier texture I expected.   We finished our food but left our drinks 2/3 full.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious flavors in the Pig &#39;n Puddin&#39;. The chorizo Enchiladas in the back weren&#39;t bad. Fresh avocado!
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. These look mediocre and taste even worse.

2qqKm0nLzT8CRUDFROokPA.text: FeelsGoodMan ;)  Delicious Food and Good Drink ,and Bonus is NICE Dude gave service ! Yeah . Definitely come back !

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U5oTG_JmC6i6ajugNPAFZQ.text: It's unfortunate the poor service colors the experience here. 2 tables of people along the wall wait over 10 minutes to see a server. Who has been wandering around doing who knows what.   When he shows up, he has a passive aggressive tone that suggests we should all be grateful that he has arrived.  Of course the shame is that other servers are hustling, checking in, and the food does arrive in decent time, now if I only had silverware...

m0S_2Hl6pAVHWgZUlxwqLg.text: The bartender at 7am today has literally the best personality.  He greeted me before anyone else, offered up options for drinks and such. (Hey it's an airport! No one can judge a 7am mimosa).  He's been talking to everyone, and went out of his way to make sure i could get just a fruit cup (I'm not that hungry) customer service is on point here!  Update: his name is Russell!!! The best!!

H-6WGoVdka06jhctbdaaow.text: Only acceptable food if you are starving. My wife ordered a dinner that came with al dente Brussel sprouts that were listed as actually cooked. I ordered a "Ruben" that came without saur kraut or cheese. Turned out that's their version. How it differs from a Pastrami sandwich is unfathomable. The overcooked potato chips maintained the overall low level of quality.

BrAtOe-10p8S_xRQb6Bd9Q.text: Terrible experience. Long wait (over 45 minutes) for service and for food to come out. The salmon and hamburgers were almost inedible (cold veggies, over cooked salmon, tasteless burger).  The beer was good though, lol. I would eat elsewhere next time we are in PHX airport.

BfKTzRR3sEAIAijgeJneWw.text: Ryan took amazing care of us. He was thoroughly prepped on Gluten free/Celiac issues including salad dressing options. I ordered the Stenson Chopped salad. It had corn, a Nut and dried fruit medley, grilled chicken, arugula chopped, and tomato salsa. Followed up with a balsamic dressing. I am SO thankful for the help as I looked over the menu and couldn't find anything to eat but he was amazing at modifications. PS. Request Ryan

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson chop/ corn/ baby arugula/ nut mix medley/ tomato salsa/ grilled chicken/ balsamic dressing requested. Gluten Free.

-1ntQrn1QBmdCM0HdATDiQ.text: Had a 3hr layover at Phoenix Airport and was super happy with this choice! The server was very attentive and quick to offer suggestions! Lots of choices sadly they ran out of steak for the steak salad but I choose the Roasted green Chile pasta and very happy with the suggestion and it was very good! Lots of flavor but needed a little salt - overall very happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZG5y1g6gO4S9w4MUoSnyVQ.text: The food is over rated and overpriced. Service was very good- friendly and seemed happy to be there.

XB01RMgYAIApnxeTxJSHlg.text: Lost in a maze of airport food, this was a fantastic gem! Lots of fresh ingredients in their varied and very appetizing options.

hjsh2zcAb1AtBsOz-qNFxQ.text: Had a few hours delay because of AA - but what's new... Best delay ever. This bar rocks, super good food and friendly/nice people.  Doug at the bar is the best! Thank you to make my miserable day a bit better.

xtm2aiGVcxH2v2QBmpVRuA.text: I once worked on a cattle ranch in Central Arizona. What a god-awful job. If you're not getting kicked by calves in the branding chute, or rammed by an angry mother cow, you're working sunup to sundown with no relief. That is until supper time.   Our cook, while rudimentary compared to professional chefs, knew how to cook every type of desert dweller the hands shot daily, but mostly quail and beef.  Well not since my starry-eyed youth have I tasted a filet sandwich like the one served up at Cowboy Ciao.  The sandwich will arrive open-faced with a ramequin of brown gravy, a knoll of thin, juicy fries, (more like pomme frites), and a side of slaw. All delectable.   The filet transcends any level of tender I'm used to, since my version of tender resides squarely between London broil, and skirt steaks.  No gnawing (or gumming) your food here. No siree.  If you have the time between flights, settle in for a few, have the steak, and imagine what it'd be like to eat beef every day and night for three months. You'd get so stopped up, you'd probably shit in yer saddle...on roundup...in full view of the senior hand who like to beat you up on Friday nights at the Punkin Center Saloon.  I wish someone would invent a time machine.  I'd go back and fuck him up. BADLY.

FtAXVTtghJ4MvUdfOHc9cg.text: The food is awesome! Particularly, the quesadilla del dia and the chopped salad are great! Even the bread pudding cake left us scooping the plate dry.  One fault- the margaritas are way to tart and sweet. Don't expect a real margarita; it's counterfeit.   But don't let that steer you away from this place in terminal four, space D. Everything else is great, especially the Bloody Mary's!

YpgTgL4kB9LQ1QuxTKP80Q.text: Delays and layovers are a traveler's nightmare! Having 3 hours to kill within an airport, my hubby and I decided to get some lunch and waste some time. We asked a worker at a gift shop what her favorite food spot is in the airport. She immediately directed us to Cowboy Ciao.  Passing this place on our way to our next gate, I saw how packed it was. It looked more like a bar to me, since the bar sits in the middle of the mini-restaurant with giant big screen TVs. They do have lounge seating, which is convenient for small (1-2 people) or semi-large parties (6 people seating). There are also small tables, but it didn't feel cramped to me.  We ordered the Stetson salad, and it was the best salad I've ever tasted! I also recommend their Open Faced Steak Sandwich. It's basically two pieces of filet mignon on top of soft french bread and topped with the most delicious sauce. It's not the type of sandwich you'd imagine. We both shared both meals and it filled us up, so the portion size is pretty decent.   The price is about average (being a tad bit expensive on their pricier meal menus), but the food is definitely an original and the taste is impeccable! I wish we had this restaurant in Houston!

lwVzBC2lL-YGcInUew6dqQ.text: With every bite of my breakfast enchilada I would forget I was in the middle of my 2.5 hour layover having breakfast at an airport eatery.     It took a little longer than I like for someone to come over and take my drink order but the waitress made up for it by being very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu.   Very tasty and way above the norm of what you'd expect to get at an airport.

KEAb4E1e6UI3k5mg8j5SHw.text: Breakfast customer. Not busy - one other customer at the start, almost a dozen when we left.  First moments: I asked for a Gluten-Free menu due to my wife's allergy (Celiac), the host/waiter literally laughed and said "no". We then went through the menu and the waiter was "kind" enough to explain how some things are prepared. We were able to figure out how to accommodate my wife.  Another member of my party is lactose intolerant...asking for non-dairy creamer and again, another response of "no, only milk or half/half".  The food arrived and it was reported that one of our party's meal was "forgot"...and "...they were starting it right now." I was 3/4 done with my food when his came out of the kitchen.    The server eventually became attentive and respectful towards the end of the experience. He then offered to let us hang out in our seats to be more comfortable than in the airport loun  The food we did order was good by all members of our party (5). The service and accommodations are simple fixes.

-wG2gOMX4O9G3FU4D0XbAQ.text: Guess they don't realize this an airport. We don't have time for extremely slow service.

FZjtz2lyTD_wRSwmfKLIIQ.text: I have been to the Downtown location and it was great, but this wasn't.  I would recommend McDonald's(which my daughter ate) over this place.  i had two different waiters(first said hi and disappeared), the second one was really nice, but it took 15 minutes for them to give us a new waiter. I ordered the pork polenta dish, which tasted good, but made me very ill  8-12 hours later.  My Daughter ate a big mac and was fine. not again.

pKz5c_WWY3kEbNLn3Mi8jg.text: AMAZING!! Start to finish, the BEST lunch we've had in awhile.  We shared the Chicken and Waffles and the Buffalo Shrimp, and finished with the Oh Canada.  Chicken was breaded and fried to perfection. And although a bit tough, the red velvet waffle complemented the rest of the dish well.   The shrimp were incredible; the perfect heat and light, crisp breading. The pickled carrots were the best Ive ever had.  The dessert was the perfect ending to a truly amazing meal.   Service was average; the two waitresses seemed upset with someone and were overly chatty with each other, which left our glasses empty and cleaned plates sitting longer than acceptable.  Even with this, I cannot give our experience less than 5 stars.  The restaurant space and location was nice and clean.  The big open windows gave us a lovely view of Old Town.

lRhOkhcXp-YiaaWLSCvXxg.text: Best bruschetta! 2 with tomato, 2 with mushrooms, both with cheese :)  Decent drink.  Good fast service.  Prices average.

MxOcq6QQoRtG2SLqSYMF0Q.text: Tiger prawns are more like little shrimps. Disappointed. Not impressed by the service. Will not come back

OLnicI1fYN6cN4Ti9CfUTw.text: Best airport restaurant I have ever been to.  The food was amazing, and my waitress, or culinary guidance counselor was great.  Her name was Jennifer.  She was helpful, sweet and gave great advice!   She steered me to the corn nut scallops and bruschetta duo.  This was not her first recommendation, mind you.  She gave a suggestion, listened to my response, asked a few questions and sent me to the promise land of culinary delight!  Super amazing service and food, all in an airport restaurant?  Are you kidding me?  Oh, and try the real james margarita!

01Tlrteqqh65f975YLGIxw.text: They clean the tables and bar and rinse the rag with the same water they rinse the "clean" glass ware with.  Nasty!!!!

eAEixs230A_QebM4YhjgYQ.text: I had a four hour lay-over in terminal 4 and wasn't quite sure how I was going to kill the time.  Saddled up at Cowboy Ciao for wine and lunch, and have to say, the Stetson salad was one of the best salads I have ever had (and I eat so much salad, I am practically a rabbit).  Naturally, the wine was properly chilled and delicious!  This was an absolutely perfect experience, as the service was phenomenal (her name was Elizabeth) and not once did I feel rushed or like they didn't want me lurking for too long.  I travel through this airport very often, and this will be a regular stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OMG.

Qkf7KhvCGp3-b1mbR0d5pA.text: Exceptionally awesome airport food. I had the salmon salad during a long layover and loved it. Good wine selection too. Main problem is that it's next to the B gates so unless you're departing from that area, you need to be prepared for a lengthy walk.

LMJD8oMEirvIpGCNs6gMTg.text: B-concourse ((gates 15-28?), good place to eat or grab a bevvie... And their steak sandwich is awesome! Two small super-tender (med-rare) filet mignons on a ciabatta slab, with onions and a sauce that's a great compliment! Top if off w/a bottle of Pinot Grigio that's reasonably priced, and you've got a winning combo!

YPpVytqJVyB0z8h999uz-g.text: If this is airport dining, I need to fly through Phoenix more often. The food was fresh and flavorful and the service excellent! I wouldn't have stumbled upon them if not for my missed connection - thanks, US Air!!

ttb9C8vpoQwz-SEdUctYUg.text: Very, very pricey. I just hope the price is consistent to the taste.  I thought my braised Korean ribs were really good. The meat was tender, easily falls of the bone. The mash potatoes were okay, a little cold when I got them and the veggies were cooked well. This and the other sandwich place are probably good bets to have good food in the airport.

0rLOLvNhvTavkYZSSUIoNA.text: They charged me for somebody else's meal. I paid then I was walking away and they called me back  to pay for my meal. Happy to pay for my own meal, but not someone else's!  Avoid!!!!!

tHR-w8-wGo18ou_9S0NShA.text: Had the duet bruschetta plate, the chicken tortilla soup and the burger. Tried two different wines, a chronic zin and an Argentina Malbec. Both were good with my burger. Of course it's pricey because it's in the airport, but the tables were clean, music not too loud and the service was good. I'd definitely go again on my way through Sky Harbor airport.

n0912vNRjOBzLhTrwKhBSg.text: Went there on Monday March 26th 2018 Very pricey and was ok but have had better  The real turnoff was the service as we were seated in the back of the restaurant  Had a party of six 3 couples and some wanted appetizers while others wanted entrees Asked the server for 3 separate checks It was like asking her for her kidney She said it was too much trouble and much easier for us to figure out Didn't want to cause a scene and ask for the manager plus you don't agitate someone serving your food Server was indifferent and actually borderline rude When the bill came was prepared to get even with tip that she could divide by 3 Wrong the bill came with an 18% gratuity included Never have I seen this with a party of 6 If you want mediocre overpriced food and terrible service I highly recommend this place

l_6hls_j1lRDcmqnTA2hPw.text: Stopped when waiting for our flight. There was a line but it did move fast. My husband and I ordered Margaritas which were very good and shared the chicken and red velvet waffles with bourbon maple syrup. We also shared the house made potato chips. Nice lunch. Great service.  We will definitely try their restaurant in Scottsdale next.

ZEphHzrNYwuKi0GMvHdxMA.text: Apparently this restaurant has received awesome reviews (for an airport restaurant), and they make that known on the menu cover. I was really excited to try the chopped salad with avocado and steak, per one of the reviewers on yelp, but the waitress said that wasn't an option. Fail. Since I was craving steak, I ordered the testosterone salad and the bruschetta duet. The salad was really rich, and I have mixed feelings on the drunken cherries. The steak was really nicely cooked, and the potato chips were a good crunch. If you love bleu cheese, definitely get this salad!  The bruschetta, however, was meh. It comes with 4 pieces generously topped with sauteed mushrooms and chopped tomatoes (separately). The bread was far too buttered, and the toppings were just okay. I could do better at home myself.  It is VERY loud sitting in the dining area because there's the gate intercom speakers right above, so don't even think about talking on the phone. The staff were nice, but everybody looked like they hadn't slept in days and had ultimate resting bitch face.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad with cherries. Can&#39;t remember what it&#39;s called
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta duet

DjjtvzAHYEgIYWQBl82hIA.text: Oh so slammed. I get it. But the waiters seemed a little deer in headlights. I enjoyed the mushroom polenta dish and yay for having Mother Road on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Famous mushroom dish.

reDKFfd-BJODhUKfp4_9Fg.text: Please take the one star reviews with a grain of salt, it looks like they were written by people who have  DTS (Diva Travelers Syndrome). This place is an oasis in a vast landscape of meh.   My experience with the food and the service was exceptional. I had a salad that was delicious and well thought out, definitely the best meal/experience at an airport (and I practically live in airports). Enjoy!

z_n_Ttk2NEsHap_kU_Yh-A.text: As a Yelp "Elite" reviewer, we're encouraged to write detailed reviews and as much as I enjoy writing, there are times when a simple one-word review would suffice:  Delicious.  Period. Exclamation point.  Cowboy Ciao (what a great name) is terrific.  Sky Harbor, the Phoenix Airport, has morphed into one of the finest airports in the Country and really caters to the Foodies of the world.  Each gate has its own micro epicurean stranglehold to keep you nourished and delighted without having to wander to a different gate to indulge in typical fast food fare.  Cowboy Ciao is definitely part of a heavyweight triumvirate of restaurants in this corridor of Sky Harbor.  Although we were there during the peak breakfast hours, we were allowed to order anything off the menu, always great if you're not in the mood for breakfast or your internal clock is screaming for dinner.    I ordered the breakfast enchiladas.  This was a meal worth the money ($14.99) in value and taste.  Perfect over-easy eggs blanketed enchiladas with chorizo and potatoes on a bed of homemade chili verde that was fantastic.  Service was terrific, understood we had a plane to catch, food came out quickly and check was promptly taken care of.    As you travel through Phoenix, bring your appetite and definitely explore some excellent replicas of True Phoenician restaurants that native desert rats like myself enjoy daily.  Cowboy Ciao is high on my list-well done!

l6BBZS6nfRUZD0bClAKA5Q.text: Love this place! Always have to stop by when I'm at this airport! The drinks are awesome and the food is very fresh/well portioned/and gourmet. A bit pricey but worth it!

B2JoN7sMQetmbNIN2LsuWQ.text: Cowboy Ciao at the PHX airport may be the best place I've eaten in an airport, ever.  I got to the airport extremely early one trip and camped out here. The food was impeccable and the service followed right behind. It was a win/win situation for all.  It was still early so after discussions with the bartender, I enjoyed the breakfast enchiladas. Do yourself a favor and give these a whirl. If you're not in the mood for this kind of twist, I'm sure anything else on the menu is amazing and made to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Enchiladas -- Amazing

gTVayMBwYb4DjwFLZpQNlg.text: Came here while waiting for a flight, and was very surprised with the flavors infused in their food as well as the service at the bar.  If you are in the Phoenix airport and you are looking for a place to get some good food, and a good cocktail or drink this is your place.  Quick friendly service!

ECmdO3i--oymDBxNwA3z8Q.text: Here's an oxymoron for you: amazing airport food. Wha what? Would probably only give it 4 stars but the fact that it's in an airport definitely bumps it up.   Entrepreneur Magazine named it one of the best new airport restaurants and with good reason. The food is delicious. The service is a bit slow, but overall a great experience.   The chop salad is phenomenal. Definitely have that. You can sub stake for a $6 up charge. Totally worth it. And next time I'm planning on adding avocado. It's a bit spendy, but good food on travel is honestly priceless.    Highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chop salad with stake ($6 up charge). Amazing, but would recommend adding avocado.

zdJm71whB_WIWvYMjIXcsg.text: The best airport restaurant by far. I travel all over the country for work several times a month and I am stuck in many airports. I discovered this place a year ago and now I try to route my trips so my layover will be in Phoenix so that I'm able to come here. I always sit at the bar and if you have the opportunity to have Doug as your bartender he will always take great care of you. The Stetson chop salad is my go to favorite. I get it with both chicken and avocado (Doug's recommendation actually), and I'm never disappointed. So amazing! They have a very interesting wine by the glass menu as well. Who knew you could be at an airport bar in Phoenix and get a Pinot Grigio from Slovenia! I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson chopped salad after tossing with dressing. With both chicken and avocado. My favorite!
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson chopped salad before tossing with dressing. I have it with both chicken and avocado. Amazing!

ICr5RIyKEaiVuMyrQQKLzg.text: Ordered 4 breakfast meals. The biscuits and gravy were average. The chicken quesadilla wasn't good - avoid it.   The only winner was the chocolate chip pancakes. Good flavor and well worth it.   Our first time here will also be our last time here.

ldqVlpQ0Osr100vmg7yTFw.text: Pretty good spot to grab lunch at the American Airline Terminal B.   I got the testosterone steak - arugula salad with blue cheese dressing and blue cheese topped with medium cooked steak. $20 but that's regular airport food price.   I was pretty satisfied after eating this salad. Super friendly service!

E9ihPMj35XEsIJqsIJ8POw.text: This review is based on service only, as all I had was a glass of wine.   This little restaurant/bar, inside terminal 4 of Sky Harbor, smells amazing and the food looks good. What really impressed me though was the service.
