I sat at the bar and had some wine and the bartenders were all very friendly even though the place was packed. My bartender was a dark haired woman with lots of tattoos and she was possibly the friendliest bartender I've ever had even though there were a ton of people that needed her attention. Based on my experience with her alone I'll make sure I seek out this place next time I'm in town!

GxrIW1k9YDk9uAI_UtBNeg.text: Wow. This is an airport restaurant but my dinner took OVER 25 minutes from ordering. I was told the place suddenly got busy. Not my problem. Had to take it to go for a cold meal on the plane.

GQksmlhOCDB4vXPqmjj2Xw.text: Love love love Cowboy Ciao, but for an airport, this took way too long. If you have the time, the Stetson chopped salad is the best. Three stars because of the wait time.

V7zRkUtRcqM1fHPgjYv65w.text: Is it sad to say I was actually excited to go to the airport early? I really was, and all because one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix is at the airport. Yes, Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport actually is a gourmet mecca with places like Cowboy Ciao, Barrio Cafe, La Grande Orange, and Chelsea's Kitchen finding their home there (just to name a few). Now, other airports just don't compare!  This menu at the airport compared to the menu at the original location in Scottsdale has some variations. Due to the diverse types of people from across the country, or even outside of the country, that encounter this restaurant, the Stetson salad can come with shredded chicken instead of the traditional salmon for example. The "equal parts" of each salad ingredient idea has taken the culinary scene by storm. Its recipe was even featured in the prestigious Phoenix Magazine, known for its literary prowess in describing new restaurant hot spots. Being a meat-a-tarian, it's hard to admit that it is one of the... Oh well let me be honest. It IS my favorite salad!  I paired my stetson salad with a bourbon drink.. Well actually two of them and ordered the truffled macaroni and cheese (also a Cowboy Ciao staple) because it's nothing short of awesome! Sprinkle anything with truffles (or truffle oil, but truffles preferably), and your taste buds with explode with overwhelming flavor.   Our waitress made a mistake and ordered us bruschetta instead of the truffled mac and cheese when putting the order in, so she gave the bruschetta appetizer to us out of the kindness of her heart and sincerely apologized. I'm glad she did because with all the other intriguing menu items, I probably would've ordered something a little more adventurous than bruschetta, but I'm so glad that she did, because we loved the bruschetta! The edges of the bread were crispy but the center was soft but strong enough to hold either the tomatoes and cheese or the mushrooms and cheese, depending on what bite you were holding at the time. So simple, but so good! Definitely worth a bite.. or several!  It kills me that some people will stop by this restaurant and just think it's an average airport bar-restaurant gig, when it's actually something amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Truffled Mac and Cheese
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bruschetta platter
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson Chopped Salad

kQjw5qnYvIoiSATc5yYK5w.text: Stopped in for some grub before our flight. Nice upscale menu options. Great bar selections, loved that the Mexican Mule has 2 kinds. Had the open-faced steak sandwich, which was pretty good. The serving size was just right. It's a bit pricey but I'm happy to find a restaurant that serves quality food in the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some desert to finish off the yummy meal. Yum!
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sipping on Mexican Mules while waiting for our flight to Toronto.
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ddju5v2tjIdd4Xo90-gFcg.text: Really good chopped salad. I got it for take out and it was still delicious. Highly recommended.

e7Tj5rtrxGN0vK339E_woA.text: Breakfast enchiladas were good but someone put the whole salt shaker in the salsa. This made them hard to eat.

eve2axFW_a1xtqnaVu2wnQ.text: I dined here about a year ago and remember enjoying a 5 star quality meal. That is why today I welcomed a 2 hour layover around dinner time so I could go to cowboy ciao for a delicious open face steak sandwich.    I walked from a17, which is about a 10 minute walk, but not a problem when I know what delicious food lies ahead.  After waiting about 10 minutes for a table I was seated and promptly ordered.   When my food came it was nothing like I remember. The steak itself was hardly warm, like it had been sitting out for 5 minutes waiting to be delivered. The demi glaze was virtually non-existent and the ciabatta was bordering the heel and challenging to cut through. It was lacking. For $18 I expect it to be pretty tasty.   After delivering the sandwich my server never returned to the table to check on me or even refill my water glass until she brought the bill. If she had come by I probably would have mentioned the temperature.     Overall, it was not that bad, especially by airport standards.  The experience was just so much less stellar than I remember, and the poor service bumped it from a 3 to a 2.   Cowboy ciao you can do better than this. Make me want to give you another shot.

v-3IyQQq_wqLp50OIwuYOw.text: This airport oddity offers a unique menu of delicious items with great, friendly service.  If you're stuck at Concourse B in Phoenix, hit this place up.  You'll be glad you did.

Gx_sioJyfte6ia2xco9l4g.text: Great airport food and they have amazing drink options. If you have the time to sit down and enjoy yourself then this is the best place to do so.

eNay89VGCY3Wb6-Wv72hYw.text: Price is high but fast food and great tasting. People are very friendly and seem to no what's the best on the menu would eat here again

7qjiKhhPZ7bMKfItyTH4Vw.text: My friend and I stopped here when we were flying to Hawaii for a few drinks. We tried the Bloody Mary Jane and mimosas. Their mimosas are made with prosecco which I love and am so happy about. The Bloody Mary Jane was made with vodka and mescal which gave it a smoky flavor. I think too much fresh basil was used but I'm the least biggest fan of basil so take that as it's worth. We also ordered chips with a side of pesto dipping sauce. The sauce and chips were good. Prices are airport prices so be prepared for that. I would stop here again if I were in the phx airport for some drinks and quick snacks. Oh, a mimosa is $13... Maybe I won't be back...

gog4JIxzCkQnVYX7vdqi7A.text: I sat down at the bar to have a quick drink between flights.  After ten minutes and not so much as a hi, I'm moving on.

LXR1Hfox8Fdx8EVcv3GEAw.text: Definitely the only airport bar I've enjoyed in my life. I mean, I've been to fun airports and had fun times, but I've never heard Bernard Purdie, Evelyn Champagne King or Toro Y Moi, or anything at all that resembles music, let alone music that I carry around with me in my pocket. For real, I have 500 songs on my mp3 player ('08) and one of them is Hap'nin by Bernard Purdie (arguably the most sampled drummer of all time, really), so I was natutally excited to hear funky jams while drinking local IPA's despite plane delay. I forgot I was at the airport, and that's all that mattered to me at the time. Good chats with crazy folks from all over 'Merica, and amazingly swift and beyond competent service. These folks are trying, and they're winning. Decor ain't even that bad. All aces, even for a picky vegan from far away. You're lucky to be stranded in Phoenix if you end up here.

sf1FmS_FAC58WZayT851-g.text: Great service - shared a communal table with some interesting people and watched a bit a football whilst waiting for a flight. Food would be 4 stars and service 5+.

J8YgNB_niRVPmU-dz9s58A.text: There is not a lot of good food to be had in airports, and PHX has historically been one of the worst offenders in this department.  Thank God for Cowboy Ciao--this is a legitimate restaurant with real food, a great wine list, and plenty of good beers.  It's the best of both worlds:  the kind of place that you'd eat at even if you weren't in an airport, but also a place that works really well within its airport setting.  I know where I'll be stopping the next time I fly through.

qmtTZp1ggGCYp4NxrzzY2A.text: I didn't have any food here but the service was awesome and the Bloody Mary is super spicy and delicious!!

_vIxE1DMSa4eA7JBntijKA.text: At PHX on a 3 hour lay over. This place is just what the doctor ordered. Breakfast enchiladas were surprisingly decent for airport food. Plus, when ordering a beer you could a shot for an additional  $4.

yVBdaLK5phhDrrx61Nb-xg.text: If you're like most people, the customer service you receive at an establishment is what will make it or break it for you. The cost of dining out is so exorbitantly high (especially at airports) that you would THINK an emphasis would be placed on customer service, right? Even decent customer service can offer some justification of the money you're doling out for airport food fare.   For this reason, I usually don't visit a restaurant without first reading the reviews. Cowboy Ciao (Phoenix airport) has received favorable reviews because it does serve pretty decent food and it's a nice place to go for drinks and catch a game or two if you have a long layover.   What made my experience a negative one was because of the hostess. I'm pretty sure her name was Kimberly. I went there today around 1pm. I was the FIRST of three people waiting in line for a table. When she came to seat us, she immediately grabbed the SECOND guy in line and said, "Dave, right this way". HE was even surprised that she skipped me to get to him as evidenced by the look of delighted surprise on his face and his response of, "Seriously?" As she marched him to the last available table, I looked back at the THIRD guy in line who shrugged his shoulders and laughed. When the hostess returned, I was fully expecting her to escort me to at least a comparable table but what she said was that there weren't any tables left! Instead, there were high-chaired seats against the wall where you get a beautiful frontal view of all the hustle and bustle going on in the kitchen, while you dine facing away from the TV. (Can you detect my sarcasm? ) I get that you may want to give special treatment to who I'm presuming to be a regular patron but there was absolutely no justification for that. I'm sure Dave would've come back even if you seated him in the kitchen. I, on the other hand, am forming my first impression of the place and that could've cost the restaurant my business as well as whoever else was in line after guy #2.   So as upset as I was, I took the seat in front of the kitchen because I wanted to give the place a shot despite the unprofessionalism exhibited by the hostess. I ordered the Truffle Mac & Cheese, the Burrata Insalata and the Cornbread Bread Pudding. I enjoyed the Insalata the least but the Mac & Cheese and bread pudding were pretty good. My server James was nice and attentive. Was the food enough to make me return and drop another $37 on food & gratuity after the hostess set the tone for my experience there? Nope.   I hardly ever write reviews but my experience with the rude hostess at CowBoy Ciao motivated me to write about it. And from now on, I will write reviews for good experiences too because establishments that provide good service should receive a positive shout out.

T7eufaW4dNy8KKoAnov_rA.text: AWESOME BREAKFAST ENCHILADAS! And a friendly bartender who provided quality service. Countertop was sticky but otherwise the best place I could have passed time in Terminal 4.

He assured me that my food would be out of the kitchen in less than 10 minutes.  I ordered the Rueben sandwich which was different because it contained brined beef rib meat instead of pastrami.  It included some stuff that I didn't want on it but it was served an marbled rye bread.  The sandwich was good and creative.  The rest of the menu appeared to be creative as well.  I didn't have a drink but there is a bar there that is quite large.  I did have good service from TJ and was happy that I was able to make it out in time.  The prices were fair for an airport restaurant.  Four stars!

GI9m7jQAI4sg0BdFoD0JYw.text: YUM! I'm always nervous when I stop at a sit down place at an airport. I always expect airport food to be overpriced and under deliver and with many people rushing to their flights sometimes quality is given up for speed. Here at Cowboy Ciao we received some great food, filled water glasses and made our flight with no issues. I grabbed the Stetson Salad because as soon as I saw the pictures on Yelp I had to have it. Anytime I can grab smoked salmon I am in and this salad was perfect. There was couscous, crunch and delicious bites of salmon. I was definitely satisfied after this salad and will be trying to replicate it at home. I also heard the Chicken and waffles were great, but I was too occupied with the salad to even know there were other people at the table.   If you like colorful and delicious things you should try it!

Still thought it was good and if I pass through here again I hope to eat here again.

H3j4c2RZKezxc5qRQrHK1Q.text: I have continuously been disappointed by cowboy ciao. I fly through the Phoenix airport frequently and generally only have time to grab a bite near my gate, forcing me to chose the lesser of two evils, which used to be cowboy ciao. Their food is very overpriced and significantly less than satisfactory. I have dietary restrictions which makes it hard for me to eat most types of meat, for safety, I typically opt for the vegetarian option. I picked up the only salad they offered that had no meat listed in the ingredients, confirmed with the cashier there was no meat, and returned to my seat only to find a layer of bacon underneath the lettuce. When I returned to the restaurant they made no effort to exchange, refund, or apologize. It is clear to me that they have a complete disregard for their customers and have a dangerous attitude towards the quality of their food.

mx06NGb0byLtLINeBR9V3g.text: If I could give this restaurant no stars I would! We were so excited to dine in all the local concepts in terminal 4 in the Phoenix Airport.  My husband and I chose Cowboy Ciao which is one of our local favorites.   We were seated right away, but that's about the only positive of the entire dinner. I noticed they had a couple of all day breakfast options and even though it was dinner time, I was in the mood for breakfast.   When the server came over I specifically asked if these all day breakfast options were truly available all day and she said yes. So we quickly ordered because we were trying to catch our flight and I ordered breakfast.   Some time after we ordered my husband had a clear view of the kitchen line. He could see his Reuben sitting in the window. Finally our server came to inform us they ran out of biscuits to make my order.  They took so long to tell me this that I did not have time to order something else and have them prepare it before our flight.    They brought out my husband's Reuben and because it was sitting in the window for so long it was luke warm!   We tried to split it but it was really terrible. At this point the server came up and told us the manager had graciously offered to comp our ice teas for me not being able to eat. He never once asked how we liked the Rueben that was mostly untouched left on the plate.   We were unfortunately forced to pay for the Reuben and left hungry! Pathetic!! But the worst part was we stopped at McDonald's a couple doors down to grab something so we wouldn't starve on the plane and I made eye contact with the manager of Cowboy Ciao while we were standing in the McDonald's line.   So not only did we have to pay for something that was terrible, the manager saw that we were still hungry and still did nothing to try to fix the situation! Stay clear of this place it is definitely not like the Cowboy Ciao in Old Town!!

Considering what you usually get at Phoenix's airport for food, this was a real treat.

-C9Z2ICmFvQ9T4NZ7lp0Ow.text: Wow, can't believe this is in an airport! I'm glad it is. Stopped here for a quick breakfast, ordered the breakfast enchiladas & they were AMAZING! Great ambience, great service, so full & satisfied!

ZssPvkjsX5r5PPNMH3Pzsg.text: Food was amazing! Had the chopped salad, vegetarian style, and my waiter TJ was attentive, helpful, sold me on the salad!! Travel for work all the time which is not fun but can't wait to come back and eat here!  Please franchise in San Jose!

3GxRPrlCDRR-r5l0UeTy-A.text: The food was wonderful and the ambiance surprisingly relaxing for a busy airport restaurant but the real gem was the service. My boyfriend and I had four hours to kill on a layover from Durango, Colorado back to sunny California so we swung in for a couple of beers and some light fare. As always, we chose to sit at the bar and were immediately greeted by a friendly gentleman with a genuine smile and an enthusiastic attitude (but by no means pushy!). Tige was not only attentive and friendly, but he truly made us feel welcome in a sea of unfamiliar faces. Furthermore, (and I should add that I'm also in the service industry), I happened to observe his interactions with other guests and found that he didn't discriminate in his style of service; he was knowledgable and eager to ensure that everyone was comfortable. Tige is truly a man that's proud of his craft. I can't say I'll be back anytime soon as I'm situated in another state, but if I find myself in the desert again I'll be sure to pay him a visit. Cowboy Ciao, you have a top of the line, outstanding bartender on your hands- do whatever it takes to keep him!

pVQsB8yKzmZoxfumBIP6og.text: We had a layover in Phoenix on our way to Albuquerque in both directions on our recent vacation and happened across this great find.  We couldn't believe it was airport food.  There were 4 of us and everyone loved their meal, both times we went.  The chopped salad was amazing.  We all split a piece of chocolate cake for desert and it was great as well.  If you're at the Phoenix Airport, this place is a must.  Service was great as well - we got in and out in plenty of time for our flights.

hmockUWx5eej91Ogc9JGeQ.text: Arrived early at the airport for once and couldn't get on stand-by...of course...why should I expect travel go smoothly...shame on me.  Normally I am wandering around concourses C or D...but...same old, same old...plus my local Mexican cantina was closed down...so I wander down to concourse B for something different...and I discover Cowboy Ciao...the host was friendly, greeted me right away and seated me right away.  My waitress, Monique, was both friendly and knowledgeable.  She recommended a wonderful, rich, smooth Cab.  I ordered their Puerco Lento (lovely slow roasted pork on the bone dish) with only vegetables...soft, tender, melt in your mouth pork...so surprising to find this in an airport.  Loved it!  The tables were full, littered with business travelers...so it appears to be a well known spot for those of us that live in airports.  If you haven't tried it, don't wait.  Grab a seat, order a nice drink, have a little slice of comfort after a long day...cheers!

-0ddWpROeGO8eIpBYQOgDw.text: Try the pastrami style short rib Reuben!  I have travelled often on business and holidays and have spent a lot of time in airport "restaurants".  I have been to Cowboy Ciao a few times now and have always had great service. The food is quite good, especially by traditional airport standards.   The staff is excellent, and they know the menu.  If you are in the Phoenix Airport (terminal 4) you should try Cowboy Ciao.  The Calgary flights depart from here so you sun worshipping Cowtowners are a perfect audience.     Two coronas and the Reuben were $30.  Not bad for airport pricing.  The steak sandwich is also quite good.

2coeRio1UwJDtUF_ZiJf9w.text: Running through the airport to my flight and thought I would sit down for a quick bite to eat.  The breakfast menu was small with only 5 items but they all looked good so I thought I would give it a go.  My waitress sat me fast and obviously had too much coffee this morning but no big deal, she was nice. I opted for the Monday Quesadilla, apparently they decide what's inside every Monday.  Mine was filled with Oaxaca and Jack cheese, short rib and egg topped with chipotle sour cream drizzle and fresh Pico de gallo.  YUM!  I scarfed it up so fast my waitress thought I dropped the plate.  Airport food at Phoenix Sky Harbor has definitely been changing for the better and this was just another example of how a local restaurant can serve the same great food in an airport location.  Next time I'll try the Chocolate Chip Pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Monday Quesadilla&#34; filled with Oaxaca and jack cheese, short rib and egg.

8dc6U7JM7OciurBcqYCG3w.text: Horrible service! I had a delay on my connecting flight so I decided to grab some lunch. I was seated and I ordered my food and drink at the same time, since I already know airport restaurants usually take a little longer for service. It took about 20 min for the server to even bring me my soda and said my food was on the way. I waited another 30 minutes for the server to come back out and tell me that they ran out of shrimp and they couldn't make my order and asked if I would like to order anything else. At this point I was already cutting it close for my flight so I told him no and he still had the nerve to tell me he'd be right back with the check for the 1 soda I had. I couldn't believe he didn't even offer to comp the $3 soda after he had already told me my food was on the way and took almost an hour to tell me they didn't have what I ordered. Worst customer service I've ever had at a restaurant.

0qVovtTL1wlbSVmbgoVfLQ.text: This place is packed - so why give a flying ... about a single traveller. First question at the door "do you really want to wait???" So what's the alternative? F*** off???  Next stage is the server with excessively negative and stressed out attitude. On the shittiest available spot at the bar he takes somebody else's order first who arrived with me and takes off. When I want to place my order he gives me s*** that I'd have wait my turn which "for sure takes another 10 min hehehe....". At this point I am ready to walk but give it another 30sec. Cancel the ordered drink and earn a loud and clear "PERRRRFECT".   Picture of 'person' posted. Keep away from maniac and this hole. Actually, I liked them and had dinner with clients in Scottsdale many times (used to recommend their mushroom dish) but that's it!  Unfortunate and bad experience. Go to McDonalds next time

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rudest and most unfriendly stressed out service ressource with asshole attitude

tJd2jxJ6lumCVJgSOEk5xA.text: Loved loved loved the chop salad!  Hubby got the breakfast enchiladas and was very happy with them as well!  Would highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped salad with avocado. Perfection!

JMquLuPugK-jOEEO9PXkxA.text: Best restaurant food I've ever had.  The shrimp was amazing, the wine was good, the service was good.  We sat way too long and got no attitude.  Yup!!!

8D4epah2FPk73TpmfQQW5A.text: $19 for an over-cooked and virtually tasteless burger. The menu describes it as some type of exotic beef. I've had far better for $7.00 at Alphys in Arroyo Grande. Might have been better if the waitress - Monique - had actually cared. When I pointed it out, she huffed and said, "what would you like me to do, take it back?"  Can't remember the last time I left a ZERO tip. Poor food is not the fault of the server. In this case the food was only exceeded in its poor quality by the server's attitude.   And to continue the rant - it takes a ton of attitude for a restaurant to think its food is so tasty that they don't need to put salt & pepper shakers on the table. The chef at Cowboy Ciao must think his poop doesn't smell - but he's wrong.  I travel for business 10-15 days a month - eat in airports nearly every day I'm on the road. Cowboy Ciao is right up at the top of my worst experience list.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THIS is how they think a Medium Rare burger should be cooked. I would really hate to see what they do with Medium Well.

2nthRy4XX1Hc1gWt_FAHDQ.text: Love this place! I try and eat here whenever I fly through. I highly recommend the mushroom dish. Cheers!

0Gteto_HAxiP9o166oCVDA.text: Here's the good and the bad.  The host at this restaurant was either in a bad mood or hates his job.  No smile no welcome feeling.  Ordered the $20 hamburger.   Husband can't eat the potato chips that comes with it so asked if he could sub a side salad.l with blue cheese dressing.  No problem said our server.  Burger was yummy. Side salad was nothing more than spring lettuce.  Got the bill and we're charged an extra 3.00 for the lettuce and 1.00 for the watery blue cheese dressing.  Really?  Server tried to explain how much extra lettuce costs than potatoes.   Won't be back.

1ndwi_Ny_4X0BcRQRZwPTQ.text: Super service and great food. VERY unexpected for an airport restaurant.   I accidentally left my wallet and one of the starters was running all over the airport trying to find me. Who does things like that anymore!?

TD6NadaKSdzTvlR5zyrCtg.text: Great service, If posable request Andy to be server, no regrets. Good food, shirt wait, not expensive and best of all good energy!!

DJe0vupcE_SQZzPRW7qmJA.text: I didn't like the name much, but the reviews sounded good. I had the Stetson Chopped Salad with smoked salmon. It was delicious!! The best chapped salad I have ever had! Arugula, dried currants, orzo, pumpkin seeds and smoked salmon with a pesto dressing. It also had air dried corn for color, flavor, and crunch. The mixture of flavors and textures was amazing. I hope I get back to the Phoenix airport again, soon!

QM9EQihaBKjF6oDBPNyWOA.text: We had a mushroom pan fry and grilled salmon on arugula salad. It was very good even though the portion was small but what can you expect with the high rents for restaurant establishments at the airport? The service by TJ was  very friendly, he tries to make it fun for the travelers who may be tired or frustrated, which was very nice.

4SMLRdG43QAARtuQRw81Sw.text: Great for an airport restaurant. Overall, friendly service and really solid food. We had the Stetson chop salad with avocado and the salmon and both really enjoyed our meals. Sat in a booth in the back and didn't feel like we were at an airport which is a nice break. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a real meal at the airport. It's overpriced for what it is but again, it's an airport so that's almost inevitable.

XwDRRYxRpxiMhELzooeIEg.text: I really liked Cowboy Ciao. The West Coast Wrap was great. The service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. West Coast Wrap has some zing. Cherry tomatoes,  corn, Asiago Crusted Chicken.  Tasty!

ibryau60KvFmGrhQIjKzDA.text: One of the better places to eat at the airport- spent $20 on a salad, but service was quick, food fresh, and close to domestic flights. I would recommend checking out if you are in Gate B

46k1zCGg4r0jfeZdF6yL-w.text: The food is not half bad. However the service at the bar is atrocious. I sat there for 10 minutes trying to get the bartender's  attention. He just kept ignoring me, or he was deaf. After I got my food, I got no silverware. Did not even get a water refill. I won't be going back.

aX2J_1g4r0uQCaMA-qBnzw.text: Gross. Don't know why there was such a big line for their stinky food. There's about 4 things to choose from. Waiter was annoying and a complete goo

zYIowEuumcJ5oH3wwta36A.text: Bad food, worse service.  Biscuits and gravy were rock hard, couldn't even cut them.  Stay away.

pHhqftyKrxH0DnojVSmdtw.text: Meh--the menu has more alcohol choices than food. I ordered the open faced steak sandwich and it was less than thrilling, for $18. Service was ok, food came out quickly. I would have had a Quarter Pounder from McDonalds next door!

1hV6j9K5Xwt_ohImM8Q9Jg.text: The breakfast enchilada is a good dish.    My husband had to send back his biscuits and gravy. He then ordered the enchilada.  It took 20 minutes to arrive.   The wait staff is run off their feet, but they are still sweet and smiling.   I'd probably still come back here just for beers.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast enchilada.   (No, I wasn&#39;t drunk)

y_Q0f7JUM82jCbpBquumdA.text: The lady bartender here cares.  She is enthusiastic and sweet and works hard to give you what you want with a smile.  Could you ask for more? Yes, good fries! Served hot! Thank you for nailing that too.  A great place to have a chat with bar fast-friends and time passes too fast here so stay alert for boarding calls!!!!

Qq5A1Tth4LEgc8fUw5klzw.text: Really great place.   Popped by here on a early morning layover.   The guys working the bar area were extremely friendly and offered my wife and I seats immediately.   I had one of the specials. And the wife had the biscuits and gravy with an egg over easy on top. This was a first for her and for years I have been asking her to get this dish prepared this way.   She was instAntly in love and started regretting every biscuit and gravy dish she has had before.   Sometimes you have to just listen to your husband. And/or the bartender/server.

sF8s4WaSElTdhbqfT8cLYA.text: American Airlines gave me a meal voucher in the Phoenix airport when my incoming flight was delayed so long that I missed my connection. I asked the agent for a recommendation, and both she and a passing colleague recommended Cowboy Ciao. So I went there.  I might have made a mistake, however, choosing a sandwich that is neither Western nor Italian: "Reuben Wishes He Was This Cool."  "It is not a traditional Reuben," admitted the very friendly waitress. But unfortunalely, every change they made resulted in a less-enjoyable sandwich.  1) The shreaded short rib meat -- reheated on the grill before being put into the sandwich --  was tough; a far cry from scrumptious pastrami cut thin across the grain.  2) The cabbage compote was tasty, but with only a very subtle acidic bite; a far cry from traditional sauerkraut.  3) The marbled rye was toasted, rather than grilled, which made its edges dry and tough. Unpleasant.  4) Cheese was extra ... and pepper jack, not traditional Swiss, was the only option  ... for an additional $1 (which was initially billed as $1.50).  On the plus side, the chips were excellent! Perfectly crispy and neither too greasy or too salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LFb3Rd8tEsTlW7l98yieZQ.text: Cowboy Ciao in Phonenix Airport was a great place to waste the clock between airplane connections. Drinks were competitive to everywhere. The menu seemed to be at extremes... I didn't know what to think of the fusion.   It didn't seem to be American or Italian food. Gourmet, definitely. My order (charred shrimp & mozzarella salad) was overpriced, but was a recommended special, and surprisingly exceptional as it kept me satisfied through delays and final flight.   And the decor was weird... Yet, comfortable. Big screen HDTV's for sports. Friendly ambiance and great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House recommendation (1 of 3) charred shrimp burrata insalata
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheers!

1RrtGMP2bx98uy_4tR5rcA.text: Short review. If you're looking for 5 star service in an airport, you need to temper your expectations or you are flying out of different airports than me. Took about 10 minutes for 2 of us to be seated, which I thought was pretty good. Good beers and pretty good food, with a wait, which was fine. I got the chicken and waffles, the waffles were good, a little crispy but I liked them. Had a couple of the only IPA on the menu. My favorite part of eating here: the lovely Canadian couple sitting next to us. Complete strangers, super nice and such a treat to have a nice conversation with really great people. Remember: not everyone is going to bite your head off if you say hi or ask them how they're doing!

5WOUuSsBVN84Ob2uBVL9hQ.text: Located in Terminal 4, to start, this was a last resort option because this airport lacks the presence of good restaurants.  I quickly scanned the menu before going in and sitting down and the only thing that really caught my eye was the filet mignon. Everything else was pretty mediocre.  The space is really small but they don't GAF, they've got tables crammed in to where you'll be touching elbows with your neighbor. It's like a family of 8 trying to cram all their kids into their two door Honda Civic. That's how I felt! No lie!  Received my food, my filet mignon ($33) was tough. The flavor was pretty good but the meat quality just wasn't filet mignon quality. The mashed potatoes were lame, made with some type of Dijon mustard, I don't like my potatoes to taste sweet unless it's yams.  I'll be coming back to Phoenix soon but this place has been crossed off my list.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 6oz Filet Mignon w Mashed Potatoes

PFhI17E4sC1R1s0JyNOpRw.text: Stetson chopped salad is not as beautifully presented as expected, tastes decent, dried sweet corn and and marinated tomatoes is a nice touch. Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry is a bit on the heavy/creamy side, yet can def taste the freshness in the wild mushrooms. All in all worth the walk to gate B22

M15BSvxitYswpYpnEdsPvA.text: Ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was moist and had good flavor however the waffle was marginal. Overall a decent meal. Service was excellent and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fqUWK5Scc4M7hdzRbF1GgA.text: Had another go at the Phoenix airport at this place had the highest reviews, the next choice was MD's and I just want THAT hungry.   It took a while to locate and luckily wasn't too crowded. Seated immediately and the waiter was prompt and congenial.  I went for the mushroom dish after a red meat binge over the weekend, recommended as "surprisingly good" by the waiter.   He was right, it was both tasty and hearty. Didn't  care for the tofu slabs, never do...  Overall, quick and tasty, surprisingly good for airport food.

41rxHd5KKvKG0S_nNXktFg.text: Well as I used to live in Phoenix and still travel through Sky Harbor quite a bit I was very excited when Cowboy Ciao originally opened their airport location. At the time I agreed with the reviews putting it as some of the best airport food in America. Sadly their attention to detail and customer service is not up to the standards that you will find in their Scottsdale location. Today I had to go through asking to order  four menu items before we hit one that was actually available. I asked the waitress why their menu was not up to date and that she should let her manager know- her response was that her management did know the menu was not up to date. Wine spectator once reviewed this restaurant as wine friendly yet there was not one option of a Pinot Noir by the glass available - again despite them having it listed on the menu.  I will improve my rating as the manager tried to make it right by comping our sandwich. The quality of the food was still not what it used to be as the sandwich was soggy but I appreciate his effort.

HVKeoM0ruuAPOhXPMSyXKw.text: Great customer service. I'm only giving it a 4 because they close kinda early for a Friday night (8pm).

k6XnR7thHlOslCqUaRXPzQ.text: I stopped in here on a layover hoping to find something reasonable to eat before the next leg of my trip. The little airport restaurant is really pretty with interesting lighting and lamps, a large bar, and exceptionally comfy booths.  I was greeted and taken to a booth in the corner where I was hoping I could sip some wine and while away the time till my flight. My server was super friendly and educated on gf and guided me on the few gluten free options on the menu. He knew a lot about celiac so it was awesome when he told me he'd caution the kitchen about preparing my snack in a safe place with clean gloves and utensils.   I ordered the elote corn appetizer with corn chips and enjoyed the lovely presentation. After only a bite or two I found something in the middle of the nicely constructed elote mound that didn't belong, a fettuccine noodle.   It was super frustrating that an ingredient that should not at all be found in this appetizer and was a huge gluten contamination after the kitchen was warned about safe food prep. Unfortunately,  I couldn't eat more and knew I would be sick in the next hour.   I did appreciate that the manager came over and was not only apologetic but also asked how he could improve gf awareness in his kitchen. I very much enjoyed the friendliness and customer service of both the server and manager and hope that they will be able to improve the safety of their kitchen for individuals with food allergies.

hE_UzY765TAPuToTqaCtog.text: How fragile does masculinity need to be to be unable to order a salad unless it is named the "testosterone salad" I was immediately turned off. Couldn't enjoy the food here especially at the prices....

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Bjk0UGQkwyYfOTb9e3y13Q.text: This is good. They had four stars until my food came way late. Boo  Other then that Very impressed with the food.  Slightly expensive but you know its the airport.  I love the new wave of bringing in local flavors into the local airports.

8KegH-E5QmGdmFioD3d9ew.text: I used to be a HUGE fan of the Stetson Salad at Cowboy Ciao - walking from D gates to B gates just for one on the plane.   changed tonight....  I immediately noticed the chicken was just not right - rubbery, and strange texture.    The plane barely landed before I got sick.   Buyer beware!!

kZi0udyzePGuWsVcfU7UMA.text: The bartender that is serving us is a complete tool... I have not received my food yet but his crappy attitude is totally worth the 1 star.... find another place to eat if you're AR the airport....

02V2BU2bBszDIW6xY_S8Vg.text: I went here for the first time before a flight and was really unimpressed. The food took a long time even though I asked in advance if I could get my food quickly. Then my hamburger was cooked well done even though it was ordered medium rare. They offered to redo but I was already late to board. The waitress gave me 10 percent off which isn't much considering the cost and that it was slow and not cooked properly.

0pS85l1wpybR2rZYUwYH1Q.text: Ordered & paid for Double vodka, soda & lime. With the last drink, something sharp was in my mouth. I pulled it out to realize it was a piece of glass. (See attached picture). When I told the bartender she first tried to throw it away. Then said ' Well I don't know how that got in there. I can get you a manager.' I said please do. Because if I ingested glass, this place is responsible. The manager came. Corrected me and said it is plastic. Didn't apologize. Did nothing. So I demanded he sign a written statement of this incident. A witness offered to sign and give her name & number. No one has reached out to me. No one offered to refund my drink cost. Not even an apology. I have reached out to the health department. When I did reach out to someone via messaging, I received a response days later telling me to send an email to info@cowboycaio.com. So I chose to write that email here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t-KjbTniagf44U5eax_XbQ.text: Food was pretty good, steak sandwich. Was out of the prawns. Bartender was way over worked bc coworker called out sick. Management needs to fill so the one working isn't a cranky jerk.  It was a good dinner gone bad, couldn't pay fast enough and get away.

tbhAnW5T2zug6gm9d-QRyQ.text: So, I had to head out to Nevada for work - and as I am wont to do, I scheduled my layovers (length AND location) based on meal times.  Lunch in Charlotte, NC and dinner in Phoenix.  Wandered the airport, and with the aid of Gate Guru and Yelp - found this place.  And boy, am I glad I did.  I was seated quickly, ordered my beer and started perusing the menu.  As I read the menu - I noticed that they were carrying primal cuts of meat, and fresh vegetables and proteins into the kitchen.  That's a good sign for any restaurant, much less one in an airport.    I was debating between a couple menu items, and when the waiter came by - I asked which he would order.  He said if I don't find myself in Phoenix very often (which I don't), I should definitely try the Lester.  So, as I have found out in the past - trust a server's recommendation.  Wow.  Just wow.  I don't think I have a vocabulary large enough to describe the flavor explosion that happened in my mouth.  It was AMAZING.  A perfectly cooked burger, topped with bacon, green chili pulled pork, and avocado.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it, and I'm writing this review three months later!  Service was very good, and - it's definitely a good place to grab a bite on your way to your connection.  I was in and out within 40 minutes (I had a 1 1/2 hour lay over) - and I assume had I not ordered the large beer, and taking it to go - I would have definitely made my flight with plenty of time to spare.  The only downside?  It's in an airport, so the atmosphere (I was seated right next to the hustle/bustle of people trying to make their connections) leaves a little to be desired in certain parts of the restaurant.  But, on the other hand - I've never thought higher than 3 stars for any food in a restaurant in an airport before.  So, the next time I find myself at Phoenix Sky Harbor - I know where I'm headed for dinner!

FKojfcN17Qcw_uwtl98mBA.text: Not your typical airport food... this was a welcome relief to a frequent travelers palate.     Highly recommended if you have a few $$'s leftover from your travels and a layover!!

JA6r6Ie4sre9qzEr-dQrJA.text: Airport business is hard. They stepped it down for this extension to the scottsdale classic. Food is weak and overpriced for what they provide here. Try harder. Might be confused with chilies.

9ZbDZs7jZa8HBW55VxvOEA.text: Followed the recommendations and ordered the Cowboy Stetson Salad .. for breakfast.  Opted for the avocado (vs salmon).  Unusual and absolutely delicious.  I would definitely order again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cowboy Salad!

PR8bYLoFY869t273SuyUtA.text: Love Cowboy Ciao & the airport location does not disappoint. I was bummed that we came in the morning so I couldn't get the Stetson salad (well maybe you can order it but I felt like I needed to order actual breakfast). I got the simple breakfast (thats my name for it, i forget what its actually called) -- eggs, bacon, potatoes, and an English muffin & it was delicious. Exactly what I wanted. My boyfriend got the breakfast enchiladas & they were also to die for. Our serve, TJ i think, was awesome. Super satisfied. Excited to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious !!

mRE0hZXOc9hqWDozmyqZ-Q.text: This was an airport lounge so I wasn't expecting much, but was blown away by the chopped salad! Amazing! I had it with smoked salmon and avocado.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HJm1JBW79dQFY8XhENXShA.text: If there were less than 1 star, or negative stars, I'd rate it with that. I have been sitting here for upwards of 40 minutes and have not been approached once. I ordered my beer at the bar and then took a seat along the wall, and on two separate occasions the waitresses; two depicted in my attached photos, stood around socializing scanning the room, and conveniently not realizing I was sitting 10 feet away from them. So my glass is empty, no one has asked me if I would like an appetizer or a meal, and there are probably two or three other people with a quizzical look on there faces, wondering if someone will notice them too.  I wish I could have attached a picture of the time going by as I sit here with an empty glass and the table with no food on it.  So the girl depicted in my photograph finally approached me and then scolded me for having not followed whatever protocol they have for establishing a tab. Apparently if I bought a beer at the bar and then chose to sit down at a table I am prohibited from attaining any additional service.  It's the girl with her hair in a fountain style ponytail.

Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qfB-ZZRlOzOCuzdynT298Q.text: Had an hour layover in Phoenix and decided to give this place a shot. Not only was the food/drinks phenomenal, but the service (Ty was my bartender) was even better. A bit pricy, but you're definitely getting what you pay for! I'll 100% come back if I ever happen to be in this airport again.

y34mCiEsF0o2gry95m6l5w.text: Situated opposite gate B21, Cowboy Ciao was work the hike from terminal C. Restaurants at airports tens to be sub par and expensive. However my experience here was quality food and fairly expensive.   Firstly the ambience and service was great. My server was super friendly and was able help me through the various tantalizing dishes on display. I finally went with the exotic Mushroom dish, served on double baked Polenta. This dish consisted of 9 different types of mushrooms in a delicious cream sauce.  This entree is rich in flavor and is pretty substantial.   I struck up a conversation with another traveller who had their signature salad. I had a taste - was refreshingly delicious and if you are looking for something lighter this is definitely a salad worth trying!!  I give it 4 stars ... But the prices are a little on the high side, so I give it 3.8.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lighting!
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fS9J9y-r2ETi63sydEELMA.text: Stopped here for a late lunch before catching a flight. I love this place! It's eclectic, they play cool music and the servers/bartenders really take good care of you.   I ordered the Upper Manhattan for a cocktail - which was made perfectly. I also tried the Testosterone Salad and it was amazing. Grilled beef tenderloin with leafy greens, huge raisins and Maytag blue cheese. It doesn't get any better than this. The meat was cooked perfectly and all the flavors really came together. For a first time visit, this salad really hit it out of the park for me.   They have a really nice wine selection here, and the range of food to choose from will make any foodie happy. The atmosphere here is also different. I can't put my finger on it - but the bartenders keep the customers entertained and everyone seems to really have a good time here.   I will definitely stop here again next time i'm passing through terminal 4. Given the typical lousy airport food options most travelers are used to, you need to give this place a try!

UqNyf737ke-PCHJpziO-Xg.text: just two drinks and an appetizer in between flights.  Was trying to watch the football game, but they kept messing with the channels and changing channels, it was a little annoying, not sure why they were doing this, but people seemed agitated like us.  Didn't spend much time there, waiter was helpful but offered no suggestions. Took a shot in the dark, it was okay to pass the time.

K-pe5UvqA5phZbFko6-ECA.text: Layover food choice at phx airport.   Went with the corn salad suggested by server paired with a local beer. Great lunch.   The corn was the dried variety which gave the salad a nice texture. The server even mixed up the salad for me which  was a nice touch especially for an airport joint.

GVyh1yWBkRnxylO7kuruOw.text: Pretty good for airport food. Interesting dishes.   Pros: food is tasty and rather good ingredients.  Cons: it's all heavy and greasy.

Zz7oE_iiNZwnkRQpHqB8HQ.text: Fast service and not bad prices for an import restaurant - however - I ordered the chicken wrap and was horrified when it came out with a completely cold spinach tortilla on the outside.  It had grill marks and everything but was so cold that it obviously came out of a plastic package looking that way, as a result the contents were also cold. For me that's a big faux pas.

TtcwgmWA0RleMuUhlbKl2Q.text: I was doubtful, have to admit it. This place was divine. Great service from TJ. He was charming (also easy on the eyes) and really sold it. The Stetson salad was one of the best meals I've had in 3 weeks. Really good iced tea. I wouldn't think that it would be hard to make good iced tea, but some places struggle. Have someone to eat now when I fly through Phoenix.

EyV_ZVa5St9mDU8tl2d7qg.text: I hate airport restaurants. You're trapped. You don't have much choice. The staff are generally unhappy and mildly interesting. This place was sooooo different!  We started with drinks. The choice and selection is amazing. They can pretty much make any drink.   The food - unbelievable. Started with the infamous Stetson salad. It's incredible. I've never had anything like it!  Short ribs and fillet minion were incredible.   The best part - Terry - out waitress. She is awesome. She was so caring and diligent - unseen in most restaurants - much less an airport one!  I would consider coming to the airport just for a meal here - forget about flying!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EM9gxOLjHieolX2MI2uEDQ.text: Walking in the service was prompt and courteous. Keep in mind I am traveling on a holiday which in my experience has been very light for airports in traffic. However I was seated and greeted very quickly. Our server was fantastic. Highly attentive and very personable.   After perusing the menu for a while, it was very hard to choose as things seemed out of my normal dining choices, not bad, just different. So my motto is when in doubt grab a damn burger. So I got the pulled pork burger and my daughter, as usual, had a grilled cheese. (If you ever wonder where the good grilled cheese sandwiches are located, just ask me.)  My burger showed up and looked simply delicious. I could not wait to taste it!! I cut it in half and took my first bite....and I was slightly disappointed. It was lacking in all the flavor the menu description promised. The chips that came with it were okay but also tasted like nothing. I ate half of the burger then started to read my book. About 10 minutes later I picked at a few of the pieces of pork and avocado that had fallen off the burger and scooped them up with the chips. So good! It was like the meat needed to sit for a minute to get some flavor lol.   Bow the burger as a whole was not horrible. The meat was very good and tender and cooked perfectly for me. (I ordered it medium.) Even after we spilt a glass of water all over the booth the server was still very nice and just ran over to help as much as he could.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork burger

yfzzoWXaCWJ0xIBGWi1Cvg.text: So....I've written very few reviews. However, when it comes to horrible customer service, you're more than welcome to count on it from the greeter named Collie. I may have misunderstood his name, but I was clear about his actions and mannerisms when I spoke with the manager Memo.  We approached the entrance and no one was in-line and he didn't even look up to say hello. When he did look up, he gave us a disgusting look! There were only two of us and the place was not full. The first table he brought us to, he threw the menus on the table and we asked if he would mind moving us to a more quiet area towards the back. He then rolled his eyes and didn't move. So, I took charge and requested to sit at a one of the open tables in the back. Once we arrived, he threw the menus on the table and walked away. I asked him nicely with his back turned was his manager available. He ignored me until I touched his shoulder. I let him know he was providing the worst customer service I had ever experienced, almost borderline racism as we're a mixed black and Asian couple.  We brought it to the attention of Memo, who immediately apologized and was accommodating. We made it clear we don't need anything. Our sole intent was to help him understand what took place and he said he would speak to him.   We still ordered our food and left the customary 20% tip!   We all have bad days, but this went well beyond the treatment anyone should experience. Love the atmosphere and the food!

MrZ37RMKLKF34IhJT3KkgQ.text: So I order the wrap and was not expecting the spicy part (totally my fault) and I simply am NOT a spicy food person. The bartender recognized that and took it off of my bill with no guilt trip! THAT is customer service and THAT is what is missing in the restaurant business. I am so glad I decided to come here and will definitely frequent this place because of the outstanding experience.

egFwFNYBZiwWH88HmlprqA.text: I'm giving this place 4 stars because of the amazing service we just got. We were in Phoenix on a quick layover and time was scarce. The unbelievably helpful cashier went out of her way to tell us what we could have that would work for vegans.   We got the Stetson Chopped Salad minus the meat and cheese and a vinaigrette instead of whatever normally comes with it. The woman who seemed to have a limp and probably some health problems (she mentioned she can't eat broccoli or tomatoes) was running the show, going out of her way for us and even walking back to the kitchen when she caught them putting cheese in our salads. She stopped that like a sheriff in charge of her county and while we worried about her getting around, we couldn't have been more grateful. (Give that woman a raise!)   Our food was ready quickly and the manager even came out to see if we had been taken care of. Again, awesome customer service.   The menu is limited for vegans but we made it work and the Stetson Chopped Salad was quite good. It has freeze-dried fresh corn (new to me) and we got avocado instead of chicken.  Really really good. It already comes with cous cous which makes it quite filling.    The food was decent but if I could make that cashier my grandmother and take care of her forever I would. Be nice to her if you see her.

E_xCqPLFsBUcII4xC0V6YA.text: On route to Philadelphia for a busy trip and had a 2 hour layover. Always hit and miss with airport food so checked on Yelp first to check reviews.  Had the shrimp tacos and it was really good.  Shrimp was cooked to perfection. Pretty big portion so it was pretty filling.

jyqLx21BPQHLwX819zSOCQ.text: They make some tasty food, but the lack of service and the prices being steep kept it from getting a better rating.   I basically settled because it was next to my gate (22). I pretty much almost seated myself. Had to get my own utensils and straw. And... I was seated at a kinda unclean table. I should've moved myself, but tired and luggage, you know? It was thoughtlessness I endureed mostly, but I was like, "did I do something to them. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Enchilada; sunny side.
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ceiling decor

dow3RmKsaChMhIveCDri8A.text: Had the ciao burger. Menu said it was wagyu, it was not. It was dry and tough. Probably no better than the frozen patties you get from the grocery. Came with a stale bun about 40% bigger than the patty and a total of 9 fries.  I'd recommend saving half your money and going to the McDonald's ext door.

X43ko1mOE6fqXhyqqs0Weg.text: Not bad for airport fare. If you're at PHX and need to kill a few hours over a bite or a few drinks, this will do the trick. I had the chili verde fries, which were very satisfying, and the service was terrific - very friendly, attentive, and helpful. I wouldn't go so far to say that it was great even by the standards of airport food, but it was better than serviceable.

9WqD1uQzfF6q8N0mLupzdQ.text: I stopped in here for a quick dinner before my flight home. I sat at the bar and ordered the fried chicken sandwich. The sandwich was pretty good, I especially liked the slaw that came on it. Nothing too special or unique when it comes to the food, but what I was most impressed with was the service! I had Ty the bartender and he was just the best! So warm and friendly and gave the most amazing service. He also seemed on top of making sure we got our orders in timely manner (which is of course of prime importance at the airport). He was just very attentive and really seemed to just enjoy his job and also brightened my day which had been pretty rough. We need more people like Ty around! Definitely recommend stopping in for a quick bite if you find yourself at sky harbor, if not for the food then definitely for the service from Ty!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried chicken sandwich with their signature slaw and fries

AkdwURh3bzqBmLXCE4-Ljw.text: Ok so I checked the Yelp community for a suggestion. Cowboy Stetson salad was the choice...I went with the Stetson salad and I added chicken. It was fantastic. The portion is a little small for me but great taste. Good news boys, this salad is not a leafy green salad. It can carry it self as a "man's salad". This is a goodee. Also for those of you who love avocado and/or bacon, ask for it to be added and the staff is more than happy to accommodate. I only added the chicken and was happy.  Now for the down side. Ordered the shrimp with polenta. The description on the menu sounds fab but it really falls short. One of my pet peeves is bars or restaurants serving limes that are "woody" or have no juice. It is annoying....stop doing it! So the polenta was dry and had a poor texture. The shrimp were not over cooked but they had no flavor. ...and the lime had apparently crossed the desert before being plated  Safe travels! I'll be back for the salad.

hiLzROR9SQ6lsOcN-FtZyA.text: I've been here several times while traveling to/from (or through PHX). They have a great grab and go section, but also have a full service restaurant. On my last visit, I was able to grab a quick bite--we were seated immediately, and service was fast and friendly. I got my famous stetson salad (note, the salmon version is by order only... chicken in the grab and go version), and had a happy belly before my evening flight home.

OxWxN1QHt64dVxnQhymNIQ.text: The food came out cold and there was a hair in it. I just ended up giving it back and going to McDonald's next door. I was very disappointed.

-Tyv__Ogn5OunauZq-Epgw.text: Well, I tried again, during busier hours, and was disappointed again. This time, they grumbled about seating us at an available table because it was "busy." Yet a party of two just left that table, and we're another party of two. And at the time, there was us, and one other party of two waiting. And last time, you closed the kitchen two hours early. Not exactly customer forward. I will not get burned again by this restaurant. Totally not happy with this place, which makes me sad because I used to really love the location in Scottsdale.

QnroLRE455PQCUMAQdILNw.text: Their menu has funny "quotes" from their "customers".  And I just might have to agree with some of them.   They've got few local brews on tap, that made me happy.  I was on the fence between testosterone salad and flat iron.  After some research on yelp and ig, I decided on the testosterone salad. Glad I did.   It was tasty and refreshing.   The tendeloin steak was not medium rare but was still tender. Service was ok.  We asked for hot water and the guy said they don't have any, only tap.  How can you have a full bar and full kitchen but no hot water? Price is as expected at an airport, inflated to take advantage of hungry travelers. Location is nice, good ambience.  Great spot for people watch with counter seats facing the gates.  Food 4* Service 3* Price 3* Location 4*

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Testosterone salad

b5TZZLP962Qjnw8AOYkFwg.text: Reasonably priced for the airport. Waygu hamburger. Asked for medium. Got well done. Skimpy on cheese. Bun was very large. Chicken sandwich. Fried chicken good. Bun too large. French fries were ok.  Waiter took a while and forgot parts of our order.

7TJU9Rd_H5WNAsG9O0QaRg.text: 3  1/2 stars for Cowboy Ciao.  I had a few hours to kill at PHX, so I literally walked up and down the terminals checking out all of the restaurants. I would've just used Yelp, but was having difficulty with the phone app that day. After working up an appetite, I decide to get a big ol' burger and fries so I landed at Cowboy Ciao. Good news, they had burgers! Bad news, they did NOT have French Fries. Doh! I seriously considered leaving, but decided I was too tired from my walk-a-thon and would have to live without fries.  As most airport restaurants, space was tight between tables. Since I was by myself, it was okay, as I placed my carry-on on one chair and my backpack on another. I ordered "Lester's Burger Bonanza" which was served with green chile pork, avocado, bacon, and homemade chips. If they could make chips, why couldn't they make fries? Deep fried is deep fried. *sigh* Anyway, I'm a big wimp when it comes to anything spicy, so I asked for the jalapeno aioli on the side. One plus for Cowboy Ciao is that they will cook a burger to order instead of cooking it well done by default. I like a nice medium rare burger, thank you.  When he brought out my burger, it didn't look right. You know why? No french fries! Ha ha! Just kidding. He forgot the pork. Once we got that squared away, I was ready to devour my burger. This was a pretty sizable burger, especially since it was on a big ol' Challah roll. I just squished it down and went at it. It was definitely a messy burger, but I must've made it look good, because the two ladies next to me asked me what I had.   I was stuffed when I was done, so that's always a good thing. You know airport food isn't cheap, so I won't even bother mentioning the price. If you are craving a burger and fries, Cowboy Ciao isn't your place. However, if the fries aren't a deal-breaker, I'd recommend Cowboy Ciao and specifically the Lester's Burger Bonanza.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lester&#39;s Burger Bonanza
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Medium Rare
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lmcoWWjv2ht79KfajPSgog.text: I somehow always end up here for breakfast at the airport even though there are tons of options. I also somehow always am seated in Victor's section, who makes the experience amazing. Victor is so friendly and attentive, makes great recommendations, and is a real treat to talk to.   As for the food, it's all great. My favorite is the Breakfast Quesadilla, but you can't really go wrong with any of the options they have. They also have great coffee, which I usually drink at least four cups of.   Overall 5/5, definitely go here next time you're at the airport

wJfYR8ANH4w5GbBBgZuKCQ.text: Very friendly staff. The food was good and the drinks were ok.  I did not like the fact that the tables were so crammed and it was hard to get through the restaurant.  Because of the friendly staff it is a good place to hang out while waiting for your next flight.

VvtDM6LC4Xatk4f76vkg2Q.text: This was the airport restaurant location. The meal was quite enjoyable as far as restaurants go. This was the best option for dining on the Go at the airport. I had the  tiger prawns with grits, the tomato basil soup, the fried chicken sandwich and the wagyu burger. All the food was cooked well and had great ingredients. The grits were very bland, but the prawns were fresh and cooked well. The fried chicken sandwich was crisp and flavorful. The fries were thick cut and fresh. I asked for  a medium well burger, and they over cooked it. The patty was bland and lacking in character. It was definitely not wagyu. The cheese,sauce, and brioche bun made up for the lack over flavor. The prices were a bit high, but it was a decent meal altogether.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wagyu Burger

Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wagyu Burger

YpIdPYdnerMFrz1sKroGfQ.text: The Stetson chopped salad with chicken is my go to every time I stop in. Its presented with each ingredient piled into a line, one next to the other and is served with a pesto buttermilk dressing. The flavor combination is so good. It's definitely a one of a kind salad.  I wasn't a fan of the restaurant's version of a Moscow Mule. My server did warn me that it was different and made with a smoky liquor, which I thought I'd be okay with, however it did taste more like tequila instead of vodka, and overpowered the drink. Very much the opposite of what I know a Moscow Mule to be.   Lastly, I'm not sure why they don't serve the salad with your normal set of utensils. I'd assumed it was a one-off, but after three visits and only two large mixing spoons provided each time, I have to assume the idea is spoon feed the salad to oneself......Anyway, be proactive and order utensils with your salad, or walk to the hostess to grab a set like I did, because I don't know anyone who can eat a salad without a fork.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson chopped salad

lqdeFX6LXw1Gen37pfqjrw.text: Had a stop in Phoenix, on my way home, and decided to grab a bite since I was starving.  I've flown through Phoenix many times but wanted to try something new.  I saw this place on the information board and saw it was listed as Mexican, so I figured, "Hell Yeah!"  I would not classify this place as Mexican.  It's moreso a blend of many different cultures, and kind of hard to explain.  After I glanced at the menu, I realized that really the only thing I would eat is the burger, which I didn't really want, but oh well. Was already sat down and had a beer in front of me.  The patty and bacon was alright, nothing special.  The bun though was waaayyy too much.  It was so dense, I had to remove half the bun barely into the meal.  It just masked all the meat on the burger.  The chips were an okay pairing, but they didn't seem fresh.  Great service, but for the price and quality I experienced, definitely wouldn't be back compared to other places in the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bGCj8U8QV3LlkgqhNomHtw.text: Changing planes in the Phoenix Airport with a three and a half hour wait to Albuquerque. We were hoping for a decent dinner and hopefully not just a fast food place. What a pleasant surprise.  The corned beef sandwich was excellent. Homemade chip to go with it.  Scrumptious !!! My sister and I shared the flank steak dish. Delicious. Prepared a perfect medium rare with potatoes and a veggie side. The asparagus was to die for...could have made a dinner of this alone. The side tossed salad was fresh  pumpkin seeds and house dressing top notch. Looked online because I wanted to make it at home. So sorry the restaurant in Scottsdale closed. I would have made it a must stop.

3VYAp5-xLG0GS8oR6AKLJg.text: Very nice place for grown ups to loosen up in between flights. Cool vibes, cool ambience, and cool bartenders. Next time I come across Phoenix Sky Harbor I'll be coming here to recharge.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice people, nice bar, nice service

nTf9mN1eCcU_whG4WoQ7Mw.text: Not much to add. Enjoyed my time at this location.  Get the chop salad. It's got this interesting textures. Like these peas. I think they're freeze dried. They look crunchy and sweet. It's a little on the pricey side for this salad but it works.  Would come back again.

h0xQ3D5DIUm_Sit1EiwdKw.text: Wow. I just came from the South and the biscuits and gravy here is better than what I had down there!  The gravy was fab boo, so rich and flavorful vs white paste. And the bloody Mary's are nicely spiced.  Heavy on the meat here, just note.
