j_EgEMQ80M0EPm1Vq1HzHA.text: Wow!   Love the restaurant, love the salad!  Our server was amazing.  The food was pricey but so worth it.  Great high quality restaurant, you certainly don't feel like your in a airport!   Wish we had a cowboy ciao in Tucson!  Keep up the good work, can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4DHX4IS6hdO7bf6gM6zgPg.text: Great place to stop when travelling through Phoenix. Great selection of beer and i love the IPA. Had the open top steak sandwich, which I can recommend. If you are stuck at the airport, find this one!!!

0KFDxpFt7L5y8oZD660_CA.text: This is as good as it gets for grub at the airport.  They have a distinct options for breakfast, brunch, and "grazing" for small and shareable bites. I had a pork over polenta with pine nuts and cranberries.  It needed a little salt but the combination was so good and satisfying.  The Rubin was also killer with great caraway and a little bit of heat.  The sandwiches come with what appear to be fresh made chips that came out piping hot.  Don't skip the local brews, Sleepy Dog Tail and the Lost Highway Black IPA.  The servers really know their food so feel free to ask questions and feel confident in their recommendations.  Not the cheapest eats in terminal 4 so if you are pinching your pennies you may want to stick with McDonald's.

ksomoS7lCExB0TzjEN_UNA.text: The staff was amazing. Super helpful and fast. They earned the three stars.   The restaurant closed its kitchen Before I arrived at 8:45pm so I didn't eat. I felt like that's a little early.  Besides that my beer was warm.

JNSMVYfUzMkbfYzQYn4Rpw.text: Had the pork chile burger thing as our waiter said it would be the best burger I ever had. Yup, insanely good! Everything we ate was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger and chips
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped Salad

wuQJVad_3zxKg2SDAh-YxA.text: The Stetson salad was excellent. The service was prompt and friendly. I had the raw salmon on my Stetson and it had a delicious smoked flavor. It wasn't enough to fill a man up and the price for airport food is high so it only gets 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson salad with raw smoked salmon. Very tasty.

7jn5deLow7pZaulRpFSqGg.text: Being a person who works in the service industry, I am usually pretty understanding and nice about these kinds of things, but this had to be shared. I often joke with coworkers about our "worst service and dining experience ever" and today I have a new number 1. After waiting in line for ~10-15min, we were seated by a host and given a couple menus (this was the highlight of our stay by the way). It took roughly 8 min after that to be greeted by our server Jimmy, who was only able to muster the phrase "what you guys want?" after approaching our table. Don't you feel the hospitality? I had a coffee, my brother had a sprite, and his wife has a coke. Pretty simple stuff. Jimmy also took our food order at the same time (since we had ample time to look at the menu before we were greeted). Both my brother and I ordered the chicken and waffle sandwich and his wife ordered the breakfast enchiladas. Jimmy strolled to his POS and put our order in. Our drinks took roughly 15 min to get to us. My brother was given a coke, attempted to catch Jimmy's attention, but he was gone in a flash. The quickest I saw Jimmy move was when he was leaving the table. We even shared a laugh about how the food might come out before the drinks, but alas, everything in this restaurant moves slowly. When our food was delivered, I wasn't happy (but surely not shocked by this point in my stay) with the portion sizes. The waffles are only half of a waffle maker worth. Not to mention they were cold and rock hard. The chicken was very dry, fairly tough, and about 4oz in size. Two pieces. Most definitely don't order this if my review hasn't swayed you away and you are naive enough to even consider going here. My sister in law said that her food was great and just the right size for her (I'm being fair here). I never got a warm up or refill on coffee, and only one soda was refilled after everyone's plates had already been cleared. As we waited for the check, I watched the table next to us get delivered the food from another table, lots of empty drinks, and very few if any smiling faces. Heed my advice and never, for any reason, come to this place if you are in the Phoenix airport. And to anyone who gave a 5 star review, let me get a little bit of whatever you are smokin'.

zP-Rpm_tInkwHO_kx1JMpA.text: Nothing like the old town location. We've been eating at the old town location for years. The famous chopped salad is different with different dressing. Service was terrible. Greeted by rude host said I couldn't sit at table or booth. Strange won't return.

dM2bSzV0Gj5qZNrsprWNkA.text: This place gets two stars because its slightly better than Matt's Big Breakfast in the airport, but still awful.

LMqH4lnq8CYW42Fq81tn3Q.text: Food was OK, but certainly nothing special. The service was abominably slow, which in an airport is not just a minor inconvenience, but unforgivable. Don't eat here unless you've got several hours to kill.

Ruv2LHVo812op1882LcE4g.text: I ordered the biscuits and gravy from the express like and was incredibly disappointed. I received 2 biscuits, just larger than golf balls. The sausage gravy was good and so was the biscuit flavor, but they were already half hard.

Z2ncGTxUTjS7Aw20tIFogA.text: OK, so that Stetson Salad is serious business. I didn't believe it but that salad was probably the best salad I've ever had. They have it for dine-in and for to-go. Since I was in a rush, I got the chicken to-go, but next time I'll get the salmon in dine-in. The Stetson Salad makes me excited for PHX!

qAX_GExGKIc4QHuaKB1iyQ.text: What a great find... food and service was outstanding!!  Our server (Justin Parker) gave us what we wanted (without us even knowing what we wanted)!!   Thank you Justin for SUPER  exceeded our expectations!!  Tiger Prawns - were cooked to perfection.   The Green Chile Elote mix was so tasty that I can't wait to duplicate this at home!  Stetson Chopped Salad - was outta this world.  The smoked 'wild' salmon is unforgettable  Lost Highway Black I PA- is ridiculously smooth... a new beer favorite.  Our entire meal was suggested by Justin... who clearly prides himself on extending himself to his patrons.  Not only are we fans of this place, but also of Justin (and we just met!).

exkRNaw4M2ObqbBTtYdpcQ.text: Thanks to American Airlines, cancellation and then a delay, I had the opportunity to dine at the CC. Yea it's pricey as it's airport dining but I was pleasantly surprised at both the quality and quantity of their food. I had the their burger, bunless, and it was huge, smother with pulled pork and green chili pepper sauce. My burger was cooked Med perfect and to say I can honestly state I am done eating for the day. Saw a couple of other entrees float by our table and they looked delicious as well... Well cancelled flights suck eggs but Cowboy Ciao does not.

vdCZkrJYLPH9famW3TrcKA.text: I felt like I was watching DMV employees. I walk up to the counter and 4 employees are leaning against the walls chatting. One makes eye contact with me and then looks back at his group so he can finish his story.   Once the story is finally over 1 of them comes to me to take my order. I ordered the burger and he says 10 to 12 minutes. Mind you they aren't busy. Dudes just standing around chatting and laughing. 25 minutes later I finally get my burger. It's a little over room temperature and bland. McDonald's two doors down would have been much wiser.

tONMUpbuD_q7yAXjw1kGQA.text: Amazing place to eat. My favorite hands down is their chopped salad but warning you now...it's addicting! I'm not kidding! You can have it vegetarian or pick your protein, either way, it's different and incredible!

_-Z3kJ36nYkLtE88faCOHw.text: Charlett!! Awesome service felt like I was at home, food was great too thanks!!   Ask for Charlett...

3QftmwMCQ6lqmgIIE8psnQ.text: I can't imagine why all the positive reviews. The dining area was filthy with trash on the floor, tables and chairs. The floor near the kitchen had a layer of grease. The server really had no clue. The glass of wine was overpriced and served almost hot. The water tasted like dirty dishwater. The quesadilla was greasy and had very little meat. Had it not been the only place open in the terminal for a sit down meal I would have left, but given my long flight delays I was kind of stuck.   The manager refunded my dinner but the bad taste is still in my mouth.

neNkMPzCwFgmPklg53mnXg.text: Never got a chance to taste the food.  I had 25 minutes until my flight and ordered.  When I asked after about 15 minutes I was told my ticket had been lost.  I paid to speed up the process and the waitress was going to put it in a to go bag.  It just took too long and I had to leave.   $23 gone and no food.  The waitress tried but....

y7MAeb0jBsywryZQSQZqHw.text: Korean bbq here is banging!!!!!!!!!!!!  Good cocktails, and a great wine selection for an airport.  I was not thrilled with a particular smell that came from an area where I was attempted to be seated, but, once I was moved, all was well. Delicious, come by if youre connecting here...

jBG6aC1n-Myuz_IohireYw.text: Great place to grab dinner and a drink before your flight. The Cobb salad is amazing! Service is great and prices are reasonable.

tmEhOQ4_j9x4sfoUHWxZhQ.text: I just had one of the worst customer service experiences of my foodie dining career. The server, Janet.... Or maybe Janice, a seemingly nice middle aged gal was sub par and did nothing to fix an easily fixable situation. In fact the head manager a tall thin man also seemed to not care about how customers were treated at all. The server was MIA most of the time, failed to fill my water twice and I had to remind her... Twice. And when she did fill the water glass it was only to 75% full. When I mentioned that she wasn't fully filling the glass, she filled my water glass to the exact same amount a walked away. Once I finished my meal I walked over to the to-go stand to look at dessert, since my server failed to ask if I wanted any. I ordered the pudding which was tossed into a blue "McDonald's style" water cup. I asked to have this item removed from the bill as this presentation was not logical to bring on a flight and not worth 7$. The manager came over aloof and disinterested in satisfying me as the customer. And just as I walked away from the to-go stand I see the server I had and then hear her chime loudly... "Oh is that my shitty friend?!". I was appalled. How does a manager hear this and do NOTHING. The food was wonderful as always and but the service (as a past server myself) was horrible. I did leave a $3 tip which was only $1 below 20% and now I'm wishing I left her nothing. The comment was more than inappropriate and I feel as though this is the only way to voice my concerns, as the manager behaved as though he could care less. I hope that things change in a positive way, because the food is so amazing and deserves great service to accompany it.

2Xs7t9Z_5FNWwaBiBrySaw.text: Three stars for the food, it was actually really great and I would have loved to try a few other items if I was more hungry. Two stars off for it to take over 30 minutes to get a salad at an airport where everyone is in a hurry and for the atrocious service. My server was downright rude and couldn't have been less interested in serving my table.

18gtPhrJ33eaXLdnuApXUQ.text: Really good for an airport. I got the mac and cheese and it was great. I will be back.

ieHIil_9MA-6etLW21yi_Q.text: One word, WOW! The decor is great and usually this means that they are over compensating for something, but it's not food here. The food was excellent and the staff was attentive and courtesy. I'm a vegan and they even had a salad for me that made those in my party envious.  My hat's off to the chef and the owner. Great presentation, great staff, great atmosphere and most importantly, great food!

IkqmdrrvuRNcp8ShzI5PNw.text: Cowboy ciao is for sure one of the very best airport restaurant I've ever experienced !! Awesome food people have a great attitude !! Try this one out.

oqvcbjHfngfyTwJKtkXHDg.text: Second time here on a layover.  Food is epic, wine list is excellent.  Had the pleasure of being served by a bartender/ninja, Ty.  I spent 20 years in the business and if I was still in it, he'd be one of my first hires.

gSTK0msApJ6dasMWExFyZg.text: Excellent service, waiter was knowledgable of the menu and very friendly. Highly recommend the Stetson chopped salad (not your average chopped salad)... unique ingredients, fresh and delish! Can't wait to eat here on my next layover!

5nW1ShSQVCeviFMRiLkQvg.text: I was (and still am) so excited that my favorite restaurant has an outpost at Sky Harbor.  We came to the airport two hours early so that we could check it out.  First of all, five stars for the awesome airport food.  The Stetson Chopped Salad was fantastic.  The truffled mac'n cheese was light on the truffle ... but hell, it's airport food and there was more than enough bacon to get a pass.   However, I have to dock it two stars for the service.  The hostess couldn't be bothered to get us a table ... actually it did clearly bother her.  Our main server was busy but fine.  The person that brought out our food appeared nearly as annoyed with us for ordering food as the hostess was for our table request.  I don't expect the same quality service at the airport as the Old Town location (which is always great) but I  do expect decent service.  Hell, the McDonald's employees next door were all smiles.  Maybe management should send in a secret eater.  You may be surprised.  So yes, I will be back (as often as possible).  Hopefully I can update this to a five-star.

CcNK7BK9fJ6mVgxP3byMgg.text: I travel all the time.  Great food in an airport is hard to find.  Fantastic food, perfect service, reasonable price!!!  Huge fan. Upper Manhatten was perfect

kpuVIAX2zU8yMyi_5AaW8g.text: Food selection is very "boooshy" and servers are way to pushy about there overrated / over priced food.   Then the server proceeded to take my dish with a spoon and start going through all the ingredients and then stir it all together - just because he liked it that way doesn't mean that's how I wanted it .......  Calm down - it's an airport - it's not a five star resturant - it's not a place people are going to be impressed with ur attitude or how u think the food has such "presentation" or high quality ..... Get over yourself ........: never ever will I order food here - regardless of how good they think it is......    There a reason the fast food right next to it has a long line and this is the only bar and restaurant that has 25% open seating

M8nbQXtFcTogouts6Y2H7Q.text: Awesome service and amazing food!  The menu is a little limited but everything I have had is delicious.

y5j8dcZ9w4AVGs192DiLpg.text: Worst service ever. I requested a quesadilla. When I asked the server what was in the quesadilla, she explained how it had beef in it. I asked if I could get it without meat. I was told no, that they would NOT. I said then I'll have to cancel my order. She rolled her eyes and stormed off!! My friends and I just canceled the whole order and walked out. Many more options at the airport.

z60zhCCWbtTZ_cLumc1Ltg.text: Yummy Stetson Chopped Salad. Great service- quick but not rushed. And wall plugs to charge devices while you dine. Well worth the walk from another part of the airport.

NFEMhoGWGB6D0NN00GizTw.text: Great food, excellent wine selection....makes you forget you're in the airport. Will definitely be back

rQhaq_sxDhHzhOEZOl6M3w.text: Airports food normally doesn't invite feelings of warmth, comfort or health. On the recommendation of the security officers, we checked out Cowboy Ciao and were amazed at our experience. The menu was creative, combining fresh ingredients with good taste. I had the mushroom skillet, my hubbie had bruschetta and truffle  macaroni and cheese. The bruschetta was so so, but the other two were truly yummy. Perhaps most engaging was our waiter TJ. He welcomed us as if we had just arrived into his own kitchen. Made sure we knew how to reach him, brought our food and drinks promptly, and checked in frequently. Never had airport food or service like this before!

HlrjMiiXY0hyRKIftjtG-Q.text: Awesome creative menu at a reasonable price for an airport.  I had the "pig n pudding" /pulled pork over polenta.  Best airport food o have ever had and I travel a lot!  Highly recommended this place.  In the B terminal at the Phoenix airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Talk about a mirrored ceiling.  At an airport restaurant no less!

LZ0vFu9dw3vto58UHvPFBA.text: Layover for two hours and thought I'd re the cowboy ciao. Major yum! Had a glass of very good wine (very short but complete wine list) and the burratta salad. I liked the salad so much I ordered a second helping.

i-tUT-DqQVfBiAfbjY5wzQ.text: Best airport food I've ever had. Chopped salad was unique and yummy. Booth was comfy and semi-quiet for an airport. More airports should step it up a bit like Pheonix did!

DoInFWuC0DWpQx60Nv4E0A.text: Going on other reviews of this restaurant, I went with the burritos. They are tasty, in a unique way that I can't put my finger on. The fact that they cook it to order is really nice, instead of most airport food that seems fresh from the freezer.

EUA38FKzQtWZwZxhDHz_wg.text: Lester's Bonanza Burger was very good, but should have been better for $19!  cornbread bread pudding was all sugary sweet and no spectacular flavor, which is what I expect at $10. It came with average tasting ice cream.

8JN-IX0SmBptrWY9L_FwHg.text: This place is a disaster. My server is one of the worst I have seen. They cannot manage table turnover. And my "waiter" can only do one thing at a time. My margarita is pretty good, but the food is just ok.

Z3a_bHTzGdiOp2mq9YnSDg.text: Not cheap but great food. You get what you pay for and the filet mignon was perfect. Good selection of wines and friendly staff. TJ served us and was great, attentive and friendly and also knowledgable about the wines offered.   It's airport good but it is good airport food and worth the money.

yyKtyPVXFwugQ6iWYdXXxw.text: Best airport food in the country.   I'm a cowboy/rancher and I approve of this beef.   Not allowed to have steak knives in the airport sooo... They drop really tender beef on your plate. And they cook It to perfection. And in picky when it comes to how my meat is cooked. So to speak.   Get the testosterone salad.  Eat beef.

1KWXpxHZwSDieSHVs9mPaw.text: So grateful for a fun place to eat when stuck in PHX on a layover!  I asked one of the helpful attendants walking around the airport where I should eat, and she pointed me to Cowboy Ciao with no hesitation. She said that on occassion, she and her husband drive out there just to go eat the scallops. (She works there, so I assume that that's cool).   Officially intrigued, I frolicked off to get the scallops. And they were awesome. They were crusted with some kind of nut (corn nuts? I think?), and served over a hearty risotto chock full of delicious veggies. Nothing on the menu looked boring. The guy next to me ate a burger topped with pulled pork, avocado, and a whole mess of other awesomeness, and declared that it was fantastic.   Way to go PHX, for stepping up your game for hungry travelers!

WJVQtbjignHMlU7yb16b2g.text: The Stetson chopped salad with smoked salmon was such a unique mix of equally balanced tasty ingredients. Delicious! Even to-go. It would have been 5 stars if it weren't $13 for a salad... But it's still worth it to let your taste buds indulge in this experience that you can't find in a salad anywhere else!

0pOA1o6RWRXlYg9hZ2-5AA.text: We had a long flight from the east coast and a long layover at the airport. Time for a comfortable and filling meal. The quesadilla  del dia  and truffles macaroni and cheese were straightforward, filling and tasted good. A cold bottle of beer helped as well. The waiter was very tuned in and efficient. The room was close quarters and a bit warm--it was 107 outside. The menu was only two pages which can be a good thing. Lots of wines to choose from. Dining room was fairly quiet.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla del dia and truffles macaroni and cheese plus a cold beer.

s3MNpP0igEqjUIysgc_BkQ.text: Amazing food!! What a surprise in an airport. We had the most delightful server named Terry. She couldn't have been more helpful with the menu and more professional and friendly with her service. I would definitely go back again and again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our lovely server Terry! Give this girl a raise!!

EbHOAbQdFVK1IlP7zFXdAw.text: We had dinner @ their restaurant in Scottsdale last night, and this place may be better!  We are @ the bar and the service was awesome!   Hayley had the chop salad (they offer chicken here too, instead of salmon) and I had the testosterone salad...really good.

HcMxWGADTik3yHetzAldnA.text: Great salad. Great wine list. Chronic Cellars Purple Paradise for under 30, incredible deal. Kenna was a GREAT server, very friendly and attentive. Good to see local restaurants represented among the chain madness in the terminal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yhITchsBznqmEsbqxMpUIg.text: OMG!!!! The food here is sooooooo good!!! The Chopped Salad will make you miss your flight! The service is the BEST I've experienced in awhile!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmmmm!!!
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chopped Salad AFTER being mixed by Ty!
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. GRrrrrrreat dirty martinis!!! Extra DIRTY!

nDE78p0U1MRP6xL7olxCiw.text: A good, but rather expensive, spot to eat at the airport.  Being fans of the Scottsdale restaurant and by convenience of being just feet away from our gate, my wife and I decided to grab a bite at Cowboy Ciao before boarding an overnight redeye from Phoenix to London.   I love the quesadilla del dia (of the day) concept.  Sure, it's probably the expiring stuff that they need to get rid of, but when folded into a tortilla with melted cheese, who knows any better.  I'm shocked mexican restaurants don't use this idea.  We also had a west coast wrap which was quite tasty.  The chips served with the sandwich were great.  Just a word of warning, Cowboy Ciao is pricey.  With tip and just water to drink, those two orders came to about $29, and they were probably the two cheapest items on the menu.  It's good food, especially for airport dining, but it will cost you.

rv8l2XqxOrgHJTlKMO3vQg.text: I had a 2 1/2 hour lay over in Phoenix so I decided to grab some to eat.  As I walked by Cowboy Ciao I really enjoyed the vibe so I went in.  One of the best moves I made on this trip.  I ordered the Scallops, sea scallops crusted with corn nuts and seared, with baby heirloom tomato salad and risotto (as in over-the-top risotto: grilled corn, bacon, butternut squash, Manchego)  I strongly recommend this dish. Very! Very! Good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. (Corn) Nuts about Scallops! *

vBcAfckfMprbPc4lNMKGNw.text: Very disappointed with the serving size for the amount spent.   I have a hard time spending $17 on a sandwich and then only get a small portion.  I thought we had street pricing in PHX.

HxQwb1WYUWNd0r9_JLGP-Q.text: Great place, warm atmosphere with a great selection of wines and beers at the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Selection of wines

eVWW5HRvamBhDQu1rLsCOw.text: This place is great. We were only here for a short time but I recomend the mac n cheese and then I recommend marrying it becuase its so good!

Z1c-uoSrX5PPJwre4P_sPA.text: Had the Lester burger, it came with green chile pulled pork on top of a burger with bacon, cheese and avocado! WOW, the burger was excellent... Have also had their chop salad before too and it was great. Food service was extremely quick too, little pricey, but expected for an airport location.

dmaFUDIgF5zAPrBmGdj2qQ.text: Bartender was cool. One male Wait-staff have ridiculously crap attitude. To the point he wouldn't move out of my way to let me pass by him to my seat; just stared at me as I had to squeeze by him running into other patrons.  I'd love to hear why personnel like this have jobs.

Sbvye846P0AiCSCFtEyEIQ.text: Just went again after a 3 mo absence....holy crap the quesadillas are phenominal!! To top it off the bartenders are even better- can't believe they remember me!!! I must have left a terrible impression.  In all seriousness this is the best airport bar/restaurant and I credit that to the service and secondly the food. And I love the food!

F-9SXnpC5PfqyPsFyknKtg.text: A friend and I had a long layover and stopped in for brunch/lunch. We ordered 2 small plates and a salad and split it all for a mini smorgasbord. It was delish!  I would highly recommend this restaurant. The Salad w/ Buttermilk Pesto dressing, the Quesadilla as well as the Bruschetta  small plates we all very very good.

gv4TIUSsy3EIFPgLJOX4Ug.text: Why, everybody's talkin' about the Stetson salad. Did YOU hear about the Stetson salad? Why, yes, I did hear about the Stetson salad, and I ordered the Stetson salad, and I LOVED the Stetson salad. Lucky you! That Stetson salad is on my Must Eat list, I'm flying to Phoenix, right now, to get me one of those Stetson salads. It's worth the airfare, promise! Safe travels!  That's the way I'm seeing this Yelp page trending. It's like a summer blockbuster that, like, everybody and their mother has seen and -- gasp! -- you haven't made it to the theater yet. It's your patriotic duty to eat this friggin' salad, you corporate automaton. Why? Well, aside from it being a healthy antiserum for those cocktails you consumed during the conference, it's likely the tastiest airport food you'll ever encounter. They nail the consistency of the salmon, too; not dry, but not so pink and fleshy that you tremble. Israeli couscous and pupitas? Wow. Put this one on the company credit card, those bastards owe you this bonus.   And yeah, I'll agree with the other critics, the service was so friendly and efficient, what a cast. My waitress swore she recognized me, and the more she said it, the more familiar she looked to me, too. It was one of those conversations. Fun. GO.

LEQfWZvvKukZPTfcd5pr4A.text: Terrible place. Waitress took our high chair for another table when my wife went to change our baby! Menu isn't anything special either, unless you like hair in your food and egg shell in your eggs. If you like shitty service, eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d689HxBdVKqvYJKR6jLR-A.text: Food was great and Victor was an amazing! Such great service. Makes a great Bloody Mary!

sCnOyuiqN9rlxxJiCdD79w.text: I don't fly often and the staff at Cowboy Ciao made me feel completely welcomed as one of their regulars; which added a 'state of calm' to my travels - thanks Cowboys/girls!  The chopped salad (I got the smoked salmon protein) is one of the best I've ever had.

el2bNPoOqJarvG3P94yH7g.text: This location is adjacent to Gate B22 in the American Airlines' gate area of Phoenix SkyHarbor Airport. We were waiting to board our flight at Gate 22 and overhead the waiter telling some patrons about the chorizo breakfast enchiladas. That piqued our interest. We left the gate, were promptly seated and we ordered the enchiladas to split. The servers were friendly, attentive and the food was delivered quickly. Our one mistake was sharing the two enchiladas-- the enchiladas are plate licking delicious.  Great chorizo, superior enchilada sauce and house made corn tortillas made this one of my favorite meals of the weekend!

_wi9P0at6-GFLur_bGleYQ.text: I've loved this restaurant for several years....but today's visit was disappointing. Service was just okay. Chopped salad was a bit lackluster. Bloody Mary was so so.  I'll try it again next time hoping that today was just a bad day.

NK8b-aYuSBaC4IWfOzEukA.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  Haven't been so disgusted in a restaurant where I just left--in years.  The waiter was rude rude rude.  He called me, and every other woman he waited on, "Hon".   How disrespectful.  When my salad didn't come with everything that was supposed to come on it I tried to get his attention three times and was completely ignored. He was passing the table and I tapped his arm and said "excuse me".  Totally ignored me.  I got up and left.  He told me I could have my bill and I walked away.  He threatened someone would come after me for it .  Expressed my frustration to the poor kid at the host stand.  Who hires these people?!  They're the ones who ought to be fired.

UMOuFn90QRIEeXyigmE0pA.text: Had the Brushette.  Best Brushette I've ever had, hands down.  Who would've thunk a restaurant could put a bunch of diced crap on a slice of crispy bread and make it taste good?   Price is about average for airport.  And service was friendly.

c2rx3S0KSsu6o7RYdV4zfA.text: Ok, I don't normally sit down at a computer to write a five star review for an airport restaurant. I'm generally lucky if I remember what I ate at an airport, much less to Yelp about it.   That being said, the Stetson Salad I had at Cowboy Ciao has me hoping for a layover in Phoenix next time I travel out west!  The over-the-top friendly server told me this would be an all-time salad to try, and after a week of eating, well, NOT salads, I figured it couldn't hurt.   They promptly brought it out for me, and it was not like any salad I'd had before. Each ingredient was set in its own line: roasted dry sweet corn, pupitas, arugula, Israeli cous-cous, bruschetta tomatoes and I added chicken.  I don't know if it was my body ravenously craving real ingredients after a week of debauchery, but this salad hit the damn spot! I couldn't eaten two of them.  Anyhow, I can't attest to one other thing on the menu but I highly recommend you order this. I may even try to make something similar to re-create it one of these days.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson salad

yJPB0kLxUlNXk3B6dHDCoA.text: Lost my order. "Hey mam, I gotta catch my flight. How much longer will it be!?!" She turns and she's totally a "deer in the headlights", but assures me they'll make me a new $14 chicken wrap ASAP.  So I foolishly wait & wait & wait... and it finally arrives: stone cold, and with FAKE grill marks. Manager totally ignores the situation right in front him. Will avoid Cowboy Ciao forever, and calling health dept tomorrow. Suggest you go elsewhere too...  PS - Madeleine French Cafe next door had a super quick (and tasty!) grilled ham & cheese sandwich for 1/2 the cost, which I enjoyed as I was running to my gate.

NVMO78Zzd53GXkweaLBnSA.text: Darn good airport food. The bar and some tables have power, and Monday Night Football on TVs. Refreshing layover

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pic of glass wall with kitchen behind window

WHV1PVpfL9MzIL0Ih4j1Sw.text: Airport food can be a gamble but this place is spot on. Breakfast Enchiladas were amazing. They can highly recommended by the bartender and he wasn't lying at all. Delicious! Will definitely be coming back when I have time to kill at the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

k4XGbSQx2BvEIYDKqiIU8Q.text: Good place to have lunch or dinner. Menu it's small but plenty of choices. I had the breakfast enchiladas and they were delicious. My kids had the Ruben sandwich and it was ok. The quesadilla was good. The soup and salad option was good as well.

mklTDzLKD87HA9bAT4H1ow.text: The wait and kitchen staff was amazing and made a layover  and flight delay enjoyable.

jtZrE6HKDo_R8rn1Ueh16w.text: I ordered the Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry and was hugely disappointed. Some of the mushrooms were so chewy it seemed like they are a month old. The sauce was delicious but the polenta at the bottom of the dish was bland and introduced a weird flavor that didn't fit with the overall dish. It felt like crustini or some other type of crunch would have complemented the dish better. Also the freshly chopped tomatoes and the avocado slices - they don't quite mix up with the flavor of the mushrooms. Weird. Overall - C for effort.

7qKo-VPjRVv4zhAJn6GM3Q.text: Hmmm.... maybe it's because we're in an airport, but $15 for a drink? WOW!  This ain't Vegas! Anyways, pricing aside, stopped in here for lunch before our flight and the menu options looked decent, the Chicken and Waffles called out my name.  I'm not one for mustard slaw, so I opted for chips with my Chicken and "Red velvet" waffles with Bourbon Butter Whip Cream and Syrup.... Sounds amazing right?  Nope, try again.  The chicken was good, I'll give it that...  Boneless fried chicken on teeny tiny waffles...  Basically, the two pieces of chicken sit on two quarter pieces of a Belgian waffle.  And the "Red velvet waffles" would have no flavor if it were not for the chicken.  Plainer than a regular waffle, the "Bourbon Butter Whip Cream" offered no sort of additional flavor.  Thank goodness for the syrup which made everything edible.  The chips unfortunately were NOT edible. I'm all for natural potatoes, different textures, flavors, varieties, etc, but these chips had absolutely NO flavor.  Tasted like the potatoes were fried up a week ago, they were cooled and left to dry up.  Super hard, not even a flavoring of oil or anything. I couldn't eat them.  Luckily my traveling mate had 4 pretty strong drinks and thought they were heavenly.  haha!  Power to the vodka, eh?!

YCP-MhNO5OUs9BO7cQecOQ.text: My favorite place to eat in PHX the only reason for 4 not 5 are the prices  Never a disappointing meal  Grilled prawns today but the testosterone salad is awesome too

v1adpDhhItqlQz-K8ETQvA.text: Amazing salads! I had the Stetson Cobb salad... I picked avocado as my protein but the salmon looked awesome too  Has take out as well as seating and an extensive bar  The only bummer is my salad cost $14 and change, which seems a lot for the amount u get. But it is an airport location after all.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson Cobb salad.... Sooooo good

fwAekSaKPqi0pIQguJQF_w.text: This place was exceptional for being in an airport. Tige was our bartender / server he was unbelievable amazing I never review restaurants at the airport but this one I just had to this man loves his job, he was doing circles around all the other employees and smiling about it. You don't get service like that everywhere.

B2lD2Aa2sGce-DzNNGLxlA.text: Quick service, decent food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. There's also a full time bar for those that need to get a buzz before or after their plane ride. Staff was nice and they keep their place clean.

SVN1tkg3BHL-_GxfYcefIg.text: I think for this review I'll try a pros/cons format:  Pros: -The service was great! When we said we had to be at our gate in 10 minutes to begin boarding, our server boxed up our quesadilla without us even asking, which was very helpful.  -The food was very good- we got two appetizer quesadillas and one member in our party got the mixed green salad. The salsa served with the quesadilla was fresh and flavorful, and the quesadilla itself was quite good.   Cons: -Not-so-great prices. 1/2 a medium/large quesadilla cut into four slices was $14. To be fair, it's an airport restaurant, but even so, it was pretty small for those standards, which was why we ordered two.  -Loud atmosphere: I realized just how loud it was after walking out.   Final take: Yes, I would probably come here again if ever in the Phoenix airport, because the food was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artistic photo of plate
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mixed greens

c-4wDBD82A5fu6fRiAReTQ.text: Late evening, limited menu, and it was very busy. Server seemed new or overwhelmed - brought my dirty martini out with a lime slice (ha!) but was friendly and quickly corrected. I ordered a chopped salad w/avocado as the protein (neat!) - interesting chopped - arugula, pumpkin seeds, craisins, dried corn, pico de gallo, and couscous. Loved the dried corn (nice texture) and pumpkin seeds, pesto buttermilk ranch dressing rocked, wish there was a lot more arugula (barely any greens in this salad), and thought the pico had a funky taste so didn't eat.  Feel like this could be a great restaurant if not in the airport and I wasn't there so late. Really wanted to try the Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry. Would def try a non-airport location.

jc4oS3A8RiSyQieWma1R-g.text: As far as airport restaurants go, I enjoyed this place. They had a decent selection of food about the same price as other places. However, not much under $15, so if you are concerned about cost in the airport, this wouldn't be the best. I wanted a sit down place where I could drink and eat before my flight was delayed. Definitely over-priced for what it is, but that's life in an airport. If it cost this much outside an airport, I wouldn't be dining here, but pickings are slim for anything non-fast food in an airport.  I ordered the breakfast enchiladas. The only issue was the eggs were runny, but some of the white was not cooked. I prefer over easy eggs, so they weren't prepared well. However, I easily pushed the uncooked white to the side and was able to eat the rest without issue.  The chorizo wasn't super spicy but still tasted good. The drink menu was typical of an airport, so I had a cider since I didn't want to spend $13 on a cocktail. The service was also excellent. The waiter was very attentive, and the host chatted with me between customers since I was on my own waiting for my flight.  I've been to plenty of restaurants in airports and the food still sucks, since you're trapped in the airport. While they have the same prices, I liked the food and would be happy to go back if I was waiting in Terminal 4 again.

8EqcIsOW3KrrJu0IjBHj8g.text: Had the Southwestern Chicken Wrap today. $14.50 for a wrap of lettuce and corn, and three little chunks of chicken the size of my fingertip. How hard is it for a cook to measure out the important part of a meal? ..and how do you complain while eating when you have to keep biting in to your wrap thinking you'll 'certainly' get another bite.. but be done before you do. Went well with my $3.65 glass of ice with coke. Don't bother dining here. Stick to the expensive liquor...

jypPkNEIItibCBZU4H8t9Q.text: PHX Airport location  Worst restaurant experience of my life.  Can't cook a hamburger! Brought back same one three times!!  Ordered appetizer, never came.  Will never go back - walked out without eating.

XqpA_yK6kpVnCCfHqJSOKA.text: As much as I hate Phoenix airport I love coming to Cowboy Caio.  I have been here numerous times and whether I am at a table or the bar the service is great! You can see the associates love working here and it seems like they are always having fun.  Unfortunately I always order the same thing which is the Chopped Stetson salad with avocado.  Prob one of my all time favorite salads.  The flavor & freshness never fails! With this being said all their plates look Delish but if I'm here I have to my salad!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stetson salad w avocado

xw6MsR2wm8bNbWB8IG0YnQ.text: First star.. The beer is cold. 2nd star.. The soup was fast and delicious. The lack of 3 other stars? Service was fair. The bar smells bad. I never received silverware or a napkin. My dishes were not cleared, even though I sat directly beside the service station.  Hopefully next time through here will be better.

H7EFxgK1lqpWuKrRVraCug.text: Great place to grab a bite or drink before a flight.  Bartenders actually work hard and hustle unlike most airports where the servers act like robots. Good vibes too.  Chop Salad is great!

gPOfWJ37CzZRT-sgJqGHdg.text: I was there to pickup some smoking pipes, at Ford and Fifth, review coming soon. I finished my business, asked a local person for a recommendation, he told me about this place, a few blocks from where I was.  Went there with a friend, and to my surprise, great food.  When he first mentioned this place, I thought Cowboy Chow, not Ciao, so I was pleasantly surprised.  I had a lunch portion of scallops over some risotto, brown, with an added twist on this.  The scallops were very tasty, a bit firm, but still great, I also had a craft beer, housed in bourbon barrel, great.  My friend had a turkey sandwich, but it had grilled red peppers, cucumbers, excellent, and the very thin homemade fries, great.  The place has great ambience, I highly recommend you visit this place when your in the Scottsdale area.

CbwfJBZKb10IoRcAxtgGpQ.text: I have been to this airport restaurant a few times now. I like it. Here's why:  They have seating. Yes, it's a sit down spot where you can catch your breath and relax. I'm usually coming off a long business trip and it's nice to take a minute before jumping on a plane.  Booze. They have a bar with your basics to help you unwind a bit before departure.   They veganize! It really shouldn't be so difficult to find vegan options these days but many airports just haven't caught up. All the pre-packaged stuff has meat, cheese or both. This place has always been able to veganize for me.   Service. Always friendly, fast and make the experience feel like you're not sitting in an airport.   If any of those options interest you, and you're in Terminal 4 at B gates, go.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veganized wrap

XW5kfzZQW_wSxwJEPj10SQ.text: Don't bother. Ordered a chicken and cheese quesadilla, they were out of salsa/pico de gallo and do not have guac at all. The chipotle sour cream is miserable. Never going back.

FQiiwJby_QXByU-8kLmAQQ.text: STEAR CLEAR, worst service I've ever had. If I could give negative stars I would, that was how horrendous my experience here was. To start with it took 20 minutes for a server to look at us, another 20to get drinks and put in an order for food. Then after ~40 minutes we finally got our appetizer which was made incorrectly (I'm allergic to beans and told the server this, however the dish came covered in beans. They took it back and you guessed it 20 minutes later it finally came out (our appetizer was literally fries). We never got to eat our actual meals in the restarting as the service was so slow and poor that we ran out of time and had to get our food boxed to go. The only reason there are two stars here is because the manager at least wasn't awful just the wait staff. We also paid $14 for a chop salad and if you look at the picture, it is about what you expect of a side salad not an entree. Overall very dissatisfied with our experience and it is a disgrace that this place calls itself Cowboy Ciao as the OG Cowboy Ciao was a True institution of Phoenix dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chop salad

BuhfEvtak5Xpu2Js-STOmw.text: Fine for an airport restaurant. Good service, though!  Limited menu, but with options that cover most special diets and food allergies. I had a tough time choosing from the small menu. Lamont of the foods are "heavy" - not something I want to eat before a long flight. There were some salad options.  Huge wine menu and a full bar. Probably a good spot for a few pre-flight drinks.   Food was slow coming out, but it worked out fine for our flight/boarding timing (we were NOT there during a rush). It's very cramped with so many people's carry-on luggage all over the place. I think the staff could do a better job asking people to please put their luggage under their table or seat. It was very difficult to get from the entry to our table and back again, and I wasn't pulling luggage - I just had a big purse.   Service was good -- A+ for that!  7/10ish. Would probably go back if I find myself in this terminal again.

rXTvcNsMr8bEfmuJZ0BNKQ.text: It is a restaurant in a airport.  Let's start there.  You can't have too high of expectations.  We ate here twice.  Once on the way out and once on our way home.  Basically, this was the closest sit down restaurant to our gates.  We had my 82 year old father with us and walking around is not an option.  Staff is friendly, if not trying to do a hard sale. They get where they are and try to get you in and out. Both times my husband ordered the breakfast enchiladas and loved them.  So much so that my dad got them on the second visit.  I got a Stetson Chopped salad the first visit based on the waiter's recommendation which was so so. I then got the quesadilla on return trip.  It was better.  My husband enjoyed their SleepyDog Tail Chaser IPA.  Prices were not terrible for being an airport.  Maybe a dollar more per entree.  I believe they have a location not in the airport in Phoenix as well.  The way out the waiter was nice enough to let us chill for longer than we should without giving us attitude.  We had about a four hour layover.  Over all an ok place.  I wish food options were healthier.  However, nice to have a sit down option at all vs. typical fast food you usually can get in an airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. quesadilla del dia
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. breakfast enchiladas scrambled eggs
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. breakfast enchiladas over medium eggs

Sr8nqhLYwefzqfeZnLsPPQ.text: My server was AMAZING, I can't remember her name but really friendly, not pushy with trying to get me out of the restaurant quick, heard her make recommendations to other patrons and was quite conversational.  I had the apple cobbler which was completely awesome! I don't usually finish sweet things but this I did and I'm so glad because it was delicious and I enjoyed every bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1IaLkYsxSw6i55TxGVJmKA.text: If you are in the Phoenix airport, eat here!!!! The food is outstanding. Best gourmet airport food I had and super fast.  I got the pulled pork on top of polenta, it was just the right portion to not have me full for my flight!  In the B15-B28 Terminal

TOikBvVWABUWBQA07HszFA.text: Food was grossly overpriced and not anything special. Service was good but otherwise..meh

CTtOjxTDZWnHDOSRGBmvLA.text: I actually ate my food before I could take a picture and post it. I had the open face steak sandwich, the steak was cooked to perfection, it actually melted in my mouth... As I closed my eyes I seen fireworks! Yes, It was that good.  Amazing gentlemen, great steak sandwich

TkDI6mt_D_8TPCu5c4qQFw.text: I stopped by their "to go" bar to pick up an in flight dinner on my way to Detroit. The "Stetson Chopped" (vs. chopped Sterson - ew!) salad caught my eye. You can get beef, chicken or salmon. Last time I checked, PHX is a ways from the ocean even if it is an airport. So, I went with the chicken. Very nice! Well seasoned, so I didn't use more than half the accompanying dressing. Expensive for what it is($14.25) but average pricing for an airport.   The salad had chicken, corn, arugula, pumpkin or squash seeds, and other chopped up stuff. Best to check out the photo I uploaded with this review.   In the end, especially with the quick and courteous service, I decided this is a place to remember positively at PHX, which has not been a happy food hunting ground for me the other 100 or so times I've been there.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The delicious Stetson Chopped salad!

k87L5ZKkYpd6expYl35qTw.text: The food was Ok.....  I don't like crunchies  on my Mac and cheese.  I don't like grease cheese on my grilled cheese.  My dad liked his and they have a full bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o8CgYl9XwFdCvcNP4eeOrw.text: I wonder when this place can get it right.  My first time here a couple months ago I had a hard time ordering some food to go to the point the restaurant mgr got upset with the bartender.  Today I stopped in for a beer.  And I had to make about 5 choices before had to settle on a beer I don't drink.  Out of Bud Light no keg on Sam Adams then the draft system is down.  Really?   Busy airport.  Please for the love get it together.  Without excuses

SGtLRUvOaP-QexasmMMXVg.text: Rating for rudeness.  Walked up to the to go cooler at 8:55pm on 8/25, there was a ton of sandwiches etc inside.  A guy walked up and put a board over it telling me they're closed...  Gee, thanks, it would have taken literally 30 seconds to ring me up...

6YcJE5hN6ifs7h8bImRRyA.text: Considering how well reviewed this restaurant is, you would think they would know how to properly cook a flour tortilla, and not turn eggs into unseasoned hunks of rubber. The staff were very polite and very attentive, but the sad attempt at "Breakfast Enchiladas" I received  for 15 bucks left me with a bad taste in my mouth, both figuratively and literally. Hoping my experience was just a fluke.

SOIAtuN16015LwtpuQqFOA.text: If your scale at Phoenix is at morning time you shouldn't miss the "breakfast enchiladas", perfect combination of real "chorizo" enchiladas soaked in authentic "Salsa verde" and topped with a sunny side up eggs and sliced avocado, simply the I've ever had on an airport! Awesome!

BnuXpF6WA38-EJg6X1LtMQ.text: During a lengthy layover in Phoenix, we went for a late lunch at Cowboy Ciano.  I had the Stetson chopped salad and Truffle Mac and Cheese.  Both were delicious.  My wife shared my salad and had the scallops over risotto.  Her meal was also delicious.  Very interesting dining experience in of one of the strangest locations: the airport.  Service was very good.

uBCXjrliDOcrQcrrz9MZFQ.text: The Stetson Chopped salad is by far the best thing at Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix. Order it with smoked salmon instead of chicken and be blown away. Every time I fly from Terminal B I eat here when I have enough of a layover. Actually crave this salad... Superb

lPt8VZOuny72PoxA9SB-sw.text: Seriously good for airport food. Spendy, but worth it. I had pasta w pulled pork, great flavor, generous serving, good service. If it wasn't for the two blowhards sitting next to me trying to one up each other for an hour with their self importance it would have been an amazing meal. :)

A7mwdPdKt-Slw0MBcSxXfA.text: For airport food, this is pretty good. I had a 3-hour layover in Phoenix and wanted to actually sit down and eat rather than just grab a premade sandwich or salad and eat at my gate.   I got the West Coast Wrap (chicken, tomatoes, avocado, lettuce, pickled onion) which also came with homemade potato chips. The wrap was good, really good combo of flavors and textures. The chips were not good though, they literally had no flavor. Now I admit I'm not a big chip fan in general but I know good ones when I taste them. These had no flavor and no salt. Good crunch but after trying one I didn't eat any more.   Service was good (I sat at the bar). Overall it was a good choice for airport food but nothing outstanding.

ioId5zsJ0eUz-JiKqvDwMg.text: I walked up to go counter since I had 20 mins to board plane- I asked about how long to get wrap- they said 8 mins- I just got in from NYC off a plane they only had snacks on- so I'm starving-   15 mins later- they kept saying 30 seconds- 30 seconds- right till last minute I had to leave because my gate was about to close- needless to say they lied and kept my money/ when I could've went next door and grabbed a soup. Thieves and liars.

E3cPUrJhTnSNAIHQ098wmQ.text: Got the chop salad everyone is raving about and although it was QUITE good, nice combination of ingredients, it was tiny and expensive. Maybe the to-go portion is smaller than what you would get in the restaurant but it shouldn't be because it was prices the same... $16 for a light salad is ludicrous.

-7KMojIABHNA0KaSfWNGZA.text: Honestly, if you're in another terminal and have the time, take the walk down to B just for the inspiring Stetson Chopped Salad. I asked my very enthusiastic server, TJ, to recommend a dish and it was the first thing out of his mouth. It's petty rare that a restaurant has a salad as a signature dish, and after having it I can see why it is.  I had it with the salmon, and then there's some dried sweet corn (sth new for me), couscous, chopped arugula, trail mix (you heard right) all in about-equal portions. This is less a salad and more just a delicious dish. If you don't like it, message me!

mwErPcAXOSgsO2rSJQrhFg.text: Can I just say THE best service at the bar.  The servers are QUICK, attentive and so very nice.  Anticipate your every need.  Food is 3-4 stars but service is 5 stars.  Made my flight delay tolerable.

gfA7yj6blGFvl8AdC_wYeg.text: A pretty good airport restaurant. The mushrooms by themself are worth four stars. Very good service.

0dvsouCZeiFS-0_WdZvLIQ.text: Generally speaking, restaurants in airports is marginal to poor. So when you find one that is truly good it's worth sharing. Cowboy Ciao restaurant in the Sky Harbor airport is worth the effort! I had the open face filet sandwich and my wife had the chile pork bacon avocado Waygu burger. Both were excellent. Great service from Justin! A must stop

D9RZslA8MA4hFsG_mh4pGg.text: Had the Testosterone Salad. The steak was tender, cooked to perfection and well seasoned. A bit too much dressing mixed in. I would suggusted to get dressing on side.   Also had a Sangria, with fresh berries in it. It was pretty good. It seems to have OJ in it, which is a interesting twist. A hint of OJ would be better, as it seems bartender may have added too much OJ by accident. The person next to me had the same thing but mine was more orange in color than theirs.  Overall a decent restaurant and best airport restaurant ever had.

Y2uY6csPOntEbDJegckQQA.text: The absolute Best service and dinning experience!!!! The Salmon plate was perfectly flavored and moist. Thank you Richard , you made my day. My husband Aj can't stop talking about it.

Lbex76IM38DlA38VjjNqjw.text: I travel thru phx sky harbor often and always stop for dinner at CC. This evening the place was about 50% full. I had my usual Salmon dinner.  Unfortunately, it took almost 25 minutes to arrive. This would have been okay, except my wife's dinner arrived cold. We alerted the waiter and he brought warned up waffles to go with her chicken and apologized. When you pay $20 a plate, the expectation is a high level of food quality and service. I was disappointed today.  Note: the server did his job well. Kitchen service was a fail.

_O43TLtzTCXofbBjqFcoUA.text: Breakfast Enchiladas were beyond delicious. Presentation was 5 star, and flavor backed it up. I will make dining here part of my regular airport experience. Definitely not what you expect for "airport food". Great job!  BTW - The service matched the food!

epYRI8djtHcAmgVqlKM-yQ.text: There was no actual description in the menu.   Instead of the expected listing of ingredients, there was a single quote from a customer who loved the dish. From Yelp,  I knew it was a fav and saw the photos of the chopped salad that looked pretty unassuming. But when I asked my server if I should go with this one or the Testosterone Salad, she unequivocally pronounced that the restaurant is known for the Stetson. With this kind of enthusiasm, I went for it, and I wasn't disappointed.   Smoked salmon, crunchy pepitas, coucous, dried currants, peppery arugula, sweet corn, juicy tomatoes came out with a side of buttermilk dressing. As I was about to stir it up, my server offered to do this for me, which seemed so formal in such an unformal setting, but I appreciated the gesture. The mixture was perfectly balanced and fresh, and I felt full without feeling guilty. Plus, I am a sucker for smoked salmon.  Would definitely return if I'm ever in this airport again, just for this salad. It was a hard choice considering the fact that there are actually quite a few restaurants in this airport that are rated highly on Yelp.

DlDwtM5t90hRzuVNUy_Vvw.text: I seriously cannot knock the quality of food. I had the fillet mignon which was cooked to perfection and my knife sliced through like butter. It isn't easy on the credit card, but it is very good food and attentive service.

RI1CyPKZUwCj_txGVfBeVQ.text: This restaurant was delish.  I got the side salad and the mushroom pan fry. Both were really flavorful. Would definitely eat here agian!

SeJ1kW7lkKM0fxYQvimYQA.text: This place is completely unaware it's in an airport. And you forget you are, too. Fantastic service, great food. Stetson chop salad so, so good. Fresh, tasty. Cornbread bread pudding delish.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s in an airport! You&#39;d never know it.

rhm9cPZ17PYULKDUB3n5BQ.text: I had a chopped salad, and it was one of the best salads I've every had - inside OR outside of an airport.  A wonderful surprise, and since I travel through PHX often I was excited to find this little gem!

D5KoclrNluzu3ePz8Ykv_Q.text: The prawn/shrimp appetizer was delicious.  The chopped salad was also pretty amazing.  Not as great as the citizen public house, but pretty good for airport food.  I was going to give it a 4 but I gave CPB that rating.  Service was excellent. You could do worse with PHX offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped salad with salmon
Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Restaurant

pCvtaRpPBf3cvW-7axpqKw.text: After a long day in airports -- and a pretty bad meal at a place in Mexico -- it was refreshing to have a decent meal here at AZ's airport! We were really close to choosing McD's when an airport working suggested we try Cowboy Caio, and I'm so glad we did.  We had the open-faced steak sandwich, which was well flavored and cooked just the way I like it (med rare) atop a nicely grilled and buttered piece of bread. It came with kettle chips drizzled in bleu cheese, but because I wasn't a huge fan of the cheese, the waiter suggested I dip them in this pesto aioli that was yum! We also had a shared plate under the heading "Grazing" that turned out to be a huge dish. It was a green chile pappardelle concoction that sounded kinda weird at first but was surprisingly delicious. It kind of reminded me of tuna casserole... but in a good way if you can image that. The wine, beer and Bloody Mary list was pretty impressive, though they seemed to be running low on the white wine selections when we came in. All in all, I really enjoyed it and was happy to find it in the mess that can be airport food.

LNiJWgHI80n8wYTmRUBJeA.text: A fantastic oasis in the desert of bad food and drink plaguing Americas airports. Stop in for a nice glass of wine and a delicious salad accompanied by a good playlist.

nha5m4oFP4GLJiIMamG9Og.text: The pan fry mushroom was too heavy on the cream, and our server was over eager to a fault. The bruschetta was good.

GNr7qyJwC2zbShKzFdqYIg.text: This place is great and it's in an airport! Really great. Nice music, great food, amazing beer and very nice staff.

RwvaSkpsrWu1OcBpimquuA.text: This isn't a good restaurant for an airport, it's a good restaurant that happens to be located in an airport. Great service, good wine list, decent prices, and delicious food.  Field greens salad was really good, and bruschetta was better than many non-airport restaurants.  Gonna hope for a longer layover in Phoenix next time.

IoucyR5QISGwog2bCfT40w.text: I'm really leaniing more toward 3 1/2 stars. I ordered the (corn)nut crusted scallops and the bruschetta. The scallops were small (only 3 to an order this is definitely an appetizer not a meal) and the bruschetta large. I saw a lot of people ordering the salad. They said the dressing was really good. But the amount also looked rather puny. Better to order from the togo menu or try your luck somewhere else. 4 stars because it did taste good and it was clean and fast service. But the food was more like a 3 1/2.

NFGkRzIFpl8PQyjH8Dw-Jg.text: Have eaten here a couple of times now since stumbling upon it at the airport. First meal, the crazy signature burger that you should never eat all of, but can't stop yourself. Second meal, the mushroom pan fry that you should never eat all of, but can't stop yourself. Come hungry. Service is friendly and attentive.

IlZCsJ-fnJfpoDkka2Y84A.text: Delicious chow! Tender, flavorful steak on artisan ciabatta with handmade chips and melty blue cheese. I'd eat this again!

HgAIOb2kfAlR3JRodG8Htg.text: Elizabeth with black short hair was one of the most rudest and annoying employee I have ever came across at a Resturaunt.  This place has a great rep from it's place I. Scottsdale.  Let's hope this lady will not ruin it with the new one at the airport.  Horrible service, rude, and annoying- unbelievable

LslpVrL7D2EepKH5Aa3okA.text: Had an hour to kill before our flight so we came in here on Friday afternoon.  Service was ok and the food was palatable just nothing to get excited about.  Booths are very comfy though so I'd recommend grabbing one of those if you stop in here.

JyHjpjDTcR34XLF_ciuYCw.text: This place is wonderful!! Finding a yummy and relaxing and welcoming place in an airport is usually a fruitless exercise. But... If you are in the Phoenix airport for a long-ish layover, make your way over to Terminal 4, and the B concourse. Right by gate B22, you will find a place with delightful options, both in food and drink, and also delightful people. The staff is attentive, courteous and engaging, without invading your space. My husband and I are both vegetarians, so options were limited, but the Burrata Insalata salad was unreal (see pic). Buffalo Mozzarella, arugula, grape tomatoes and a huge helping of avocado topped with a few fried shallots--as I said, UN REAL. Price-wise, for a sit-down slice of heaven in an airport, $11 is hard to beat for a delicious and filling salad. I also had a glass of wine (zin from chronic cellars) that was delicious and about $8. You will do yourself a favor if you head over there. It helped put a bad previous flight experience and a long layover out of my head. Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cowboy Ciao - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata Insalata. AWESOME

--XkqE592FwiqS-xF8Yelg.text: Simply the best airport meal I've ever had.  The servers go out of there way to explain every item on the menu to make for the dining experience you've always wanted in an airport.  Not stuffy, anything but.  Super hip and cool atmosphere.  The open faced steak sandwich was delicious.  Blue cheese on potato chips - genius.

0ewIS0pRwdr8BZ7BwrfF0w.text: Great food and it's in an airport!  Normally, airport food really sucks.  Even the cheesy brand names like TGIF and Wolfgang Puck are crappy at the airport.  I've never heard of this place before until I was in Phoenix on a stop over last week.   It's turns out it's a chain.  When I looked at the menu I was a little skeptical about spending $14 for a filet steak sandwich especially with $4 hamburger just down the hall but I decided to try it anyway.  I may must say I was really impressed.  This place is not just good for an airport, it's on par with upscale places anywhere. The quality of the food, the temperature and presentation were all top notch.  The only thing I would suggest is when you offer someone a glass of Cabernet tell them it's $13.  Other than that I have no complaints and look forward to me next stopover.

o_hiId-sDPt_YRhZvgZalg.text: I spend a lot of time in airports, but i think this may be one of the few trips i've been in Phoenix airport long enough to need to sit and eat a meail. Luckily the Cowboy Ciao restaurant was close to my terminal. It's  cute, nice music, nice ambiance. I'm stuck between 3 or 4 stars, but there's more factors pushing me to 3 than 4 so far,....   The hostess who greeted me was very sweet, and for any business traveler used to being scoffed at, when asking for a seat by an outlet, this was a refreshing change. the entire bench seating of about 7 tables, has one outlet per table on the bench seat    The waitress was less than friendly, and for some reason reccomended bottled water because she won't drink the tap water here ..... I drink tap water even in most latin american countries over my last 10 years of travel, so maybe she's just looking for a higher check charge - therefore higher tip?      Anyway, it's cute, clean. Food came quick. Although it appears they're going for a guormet spot to replace a reportedly horrible place (according to the story on the menu). for example on a layover i'm not usually going to splurge $17.50 for a basic salid nor $17.50 for a steak sandwich as i eathalf while running to board a plane....    i did find a decent compromise on the "Truffled 'Mac n' Cheese'" appetizer. It's not the best new spin on mac n' cheese, i've had in the last few years, but it's good. Very decent size for a $7.50 appetizer,   Wine by the glass list isn't too bad either - which for ME personally, can make a or break a place LOL :)    Anyway, overall i'd probably give 3.5 Stars, but i'm still here....so let's see how this story ends :)

GYa3CQpPpZQZrG941S3ojg.text: I like what HMShost is trying to do here by bringing in more up to date attractions/restaurants to combat the negative review in 2012 stating SkyHarbor as one of the worst places to get a bite.  The hostess was sweet. We opted to sit at the bar, as it was very crowded. After being ignored by the bartender, my husband got up to ask the hostess if we could sit at a recently vacated table. She obliged, just in time too, because after her got up, one of the bartenders left the beer tap on directly in front of his seat and beer started to over flow on to the rail and on to my Husbands phone. I caught it in time.  At the table, and our server was Jake. He was pretty awkward. Husband ordered the chicken wrap, I ordered Testosterone salad and we split a mac and cheese. Jake turned around before I could tell him how I wanted my steak cooked. Husband ended up liking his wrap. Chips were good. The Mac and cheese was ok. But my steak was borderline still mooing. I sent it back and got the green side salad. Turns out I don't like blue cheese. Or maybe I don't like how much of it was in the salad. Either way, not impressed. My water glass went empty for he second half of the entire meal. And my husbands coke was only filled when the hostess (yes, not the server) asked me if I wanted to send back the salad, then she took my replacement order.  Go to McDonalds instead....I feel like I say that a lot. And I haven't been to McDs in yrs...so take that for what it's worth. Ha
